subject: Do not perform PKI setup with init-keystone
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-05 09:00:56.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/devtest_seed.sh', 'scripts/devtest_undercloud.sh', 'scripts/devtest_overcloud.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator/commit/d4caea0663ad376b15fbfb901ee3cfed4b14fddd', 'message': "Do not perform PKI setup with init-keystone

Now that generate-keystone-pki performs PKI for us, init-keystone's
calling out to keystone-manage's pki_setup is pointless, since it
just prints that the certs already exist and exits. Turn it off.

Change-Id: Iaf0eb7f74c862213b6812bb20104658378c56153
"}]
commit_message:
Do not perform PKI setup with init-keystone

Now that generate-keystone-pki performs PKI for us, init-keystone's
calling out to keystone-manage's pki_setup is pointless, since it
just prints that the certs already exist and exits. Turn it off.

Change-Id: Iaf0eb7f74c862213b6812bb20104658378c56153
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/08/132808/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ${SSLBASE:+-s $PUBLIC_API_URL} --no-pki-setup

commit_message:
Add Ironic hardware deployment support

Currently devstack create VMs and then deploy Ironic on these VMs.
Sometimes developer may want to deploy on real platform.

A separated file is required to provide the baremetal compute node
information, which includes four fields for each hardware platform,
the ipmi address, the mac address, the ipmi user name and the
password.

Change-Id: I422b43eae6edc95f15b8c40383d0ba7fbcd9b1ff

commit_message:
Add TEMPEST_ENABLE_NOVA_XML_API option

XML support of Nova API has been deprecated with the following
message:
  XML support has been deprecated and may be removed as early
  as the Juno release.
Now Kilo development cycle started, so we should disable Nova
API XML tests on Tempest.

This patch adds TEMPEST_ENABLE_NOVA_XML_API option for setting
Tempest test by devstack-gate. The default value is True because
of keeping the test coverage. After merging a devstack-gate patch
which specifes True for stable/icehouse and stable/juno, we will
set False for the master blanch.

I4acc15ce5f487738bb34a95c2261a5d05d827d8d is a Nova patch which
removes XML API support.

Change-Id: I2ab8f5c3d15b496e0b639c99bb8592533a69a265
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/51/134851/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG compute-feature-disabled xml_api_v2 ${TEMPEST_ENABLE_NOVA_XML_API:-True}

subject: Always recurse updates into nested stacks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-12 19:29:39.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_autoscaling_update_policy.py', 'heat/engine/stack_resource.py', 'heat/tests/test_provider_template.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/80dc5b81ea978fd17edd00b102eafa0487a21d57', 'message': "Always recurse updates into nested stacks

Currently, the determination whether to actually update a nested
stack is made based on the properties passed in to the provider
resource interface.  Unfortunately this doesn't consider the
definition of the nested stack, thus any changes to the nested
template definition will be ignored when any update happens.

So instead, override the default resource base-class logic and
force the update to recurse into nested stacks, where the base
class logic will be applied as normal on a per-resource basis.

Change-Id: I547f570b038e080daefa9a96f1ce3b438ce9bb2b
Partial-Bug: #1389499
"}]
commit_message:
Always recurse updates into nested stacks

Currently, the determination whether to actually update a nested
stack is made based on the properties passed in to the provider
resource interface.  Unfortunately this doesn't consider the
definition of the nested stack, thus any changes to the nested
template definition will be ignored when any update happens.

So instead, override the default resource base-class logic and
force the update to recurse into nested stacks, where the base
class logic will be applied as normal on a per-resource basis.

Change-Id: I547f570b038e080daefa9a96f1ce3b438ce9bb2b
Partial-Bug: #1389499

commit_message:
Restart libvirtd in Debian with systemd

On Debian systems with systemd, the libvirt daemon has been renamed
from libvirt-bin to libvirtd.

Change-Id: Ib7c9ff547c8ea464d41360be3d8737442f638217
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/21/133821/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ -f /lib/systemd/system/libvirtd.service ]; then sudo service libvirtd restart else sudo service libvirt-bin restart fi

commit_message:
Allow specifying all flavor types

In I1b653020acf4b5acb510ba4a092f854815e36a87, support was added to
allow operators to specify the flavor they wished to use for control
and compute nodes, but this missed two other types that operators may
wish to change, namely block storage and swift storage.

Change-Id: I8a009bc1feaa34a98d20f5c18ea29145c00d428c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/65/133265/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: BLOCKSTORAGE_FLAVOR="baremetal" SWIFTSTORAGE_FLAVOR="baremetal" echo " --block-storage-flavor -- Nova flavor to use for block " echo " storage nodes." echo " Defaults to 'baremetal'." echo " --swift-storage-flavor -- Nova flavor to use for swift " echo " storage nodes." echo " Defaults to 'baremetal'."TEMP=$(getopt -o c,h -l build-only,no-mergepy,debug-logging,heat-env:,compute-flavor:,control-flavor:,block-storage-flavor:,swift-storage-flavor:,help -n $SCRIPT_NAME -- "$@") --block-storage-flavor) BLOCKSTORAGE_FLAVOR="$2"; shift 2;; --swift-storage-flavor) SWIFTSTORAGE_FLAVOR="$2"; shift 2;; "OvercloudControlFlavor": "'"${CONTROL_FLAVOR}"'", "OvercloudBlockStorageFlavor": "'"${BLOCKSTORAGE_FLAVOR}"'", "OvercloudSwiftStorageFlavor": "'"${SWIFTSTORAGE_FLAVOR}"'"

commit_message:
Remove Python 2.4 compat shim

It's clear that we aren't testing against Python 2.4 (not
supported by dependencies like six) and no other client
projects have this, so we should drop it.

Change-Id: I14108964c0261d9144ced16cee7101d14ca7e644

commit_message:
print the real error cmd argument

the find_command in cliff commandmanager will loop all the arguments, but the
name of the real one should be output with ValueError in a special case.

Change-Id: Ia5aefeb1e1689467cad652eb13cd911dad64184b
Closes-Bug: 1387538

commit_message:
Remove unused methods from utils.py

Most of these methods were imported when we forked away from
python-novaclient, but over the course of time, their existence
became redundant as no file seems to be importing them. Such
methods are removed in this change.

Change-Id: Ic93fc92ce624eefaeaca6de5c8fd965e88159030
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/03/134903/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: import redef add_resource_manager_extra_kwargs_hook(f, hook): """Adds hook to bind CLI arguments to ResourceManager calls. The `do_foo` calls in shell.py will receive CLI args and then in turn pass them through to the ResourceManager. Before passing through the args, the hooks registered here will be called, giving us a chance to add extra kwargs (taken from the command-line) to what's passed to the ResourceManager. """ if not hasattr(f, 'resource_manager_kwargs_hooks'): f.resource_manager_kwargs_hooks = [] names = [h.__name__ for h in f.resource_manager_kwargs_hooks] if hook.__name__ not in names: f.resource_manager_kwargs_hooks.append(hook) def get_resource_manager_extra_kwargs(f, args, allow_conflicts=False): """Return extra_kwargs by calling resource manager kwargs hooks.""" hooks = getattr(f, "resource_manager_kwargs_hooks", []) extra_kwargs = {} for hook in hooks: hook_name = hook.__name__ hook_kwargs = hook(args) conflicting_keys = set(hook_kwargs.keys()) & set(extra_kwargs.keys()) if conflicting_keys and not allow_conflicts: msg = ("Hook '%(hook_name)s' is attempting to redefine attributes " "'%(conflicting_keys)s'" % { 'hook_name': hook_name, 'conflicting_keys': conflicting_keys }) raise Exception(msg) extra_kwargs.update(hook_kwargs) return extra_kwargs def pretty_choice_list(l): return ', '.join("'%s'" % i for i in l) _slugify_strip_re = re.compile(r'[^\w\s-]') _slugify_hyphenate_re = re.compile(r'[-\s]+') # http://code.activestate.com/recipes/ # 577257-slugify-make-a-string-usable-in-a-url-or-filename/ def slugify(value): """ Normalizes string, converts to lowercase, removes non-alpha characters, and converts spaces to hyphens. From Django's "django/template/defaultfilters.py". """ import unicodedata if not isinstance(value, six.text_type): value = six.text_type(value) value = unicodedata.normalize('NFKD', value).encode('ascii', 'ignore') value = six.text_type(_slugify_strip_re.sub('', value).strip().lower()) return _slugify_hyphenate_re.sub('-', value)

commit_message:
Token reuse

Token reuse is used to limit the amount of tokens created in keystone's data
store by reusing tokens.

bp token-reuse

Change-Id: I1ea9800fe7179c1b9d70c4580651e31f12c22462
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone-specs refs/changes/75/131575/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============= Refresh Token ============= `bp refresh-token <https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/refresh-token>`_ A refresh token can be used to acquire an existing access token with the same scope to access a protected resource on behalf of a user. A refresh token can be requested until the token is within the refresh window. The refresh window is the expiration that determines the length of time that a user is able to retrieve an existing access token. Problem Description =================== The goal of a refresh token is to limit the amount to tokens created. It will also reduce the write operations being done to a backends. Proposed Change =============== Add feature flag for refresh tokens. Add logic to auth controllers to return an existing access token matching the authenticate request's scope. Add logic to token backend to get a token by scope that fall within the refresh window. Alternatives ------------ Create a filter. Security Impact --------------- Describe any potential security impact on the system. Some of the items to consider include: * Does this change touch sensitive data such as tokens, keys, or user data? Yes, we need the ability to search through user's tokens. * Does this change alter the API in a way that may impact security, such as a new way to access sensitive information or a new way to login? Yes, authenticating within the refresh window will return an existing token. * Does this change involve cryptography or hashing? No * Does this change require the use of sudo or any elevated privileges? No * Does this change involve using or parsing user-provided data? This could be directly at the API level or indirectly such as changes to a cache layer. No * Can this change enable a resource exhaustion attack, such as allowing a single API interaction to consume significant server resources? Some examples of this include launching subprocesses for each connection, or entity expansion attacks in XML. No Notifications Impact -------------------- None Other End User Impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ Improved performance, since less writes operation will be made. Other Deployer Impact --------------------- Discuss things that will affect how you deploy and configure OpenStack that have not already been mentioned, such as: * What config options are being added? Should they be more generic than proposed (for example a flag that other hypervisor drivers might want to implement as well)? Are the default values ones which will work well in real deployments? The refresh token flag should be specified in the Keystone configuration file. * Is this a change that takes immediate effect after its merged, or is it something that has to be explicitly enabled? This would be a feature and not enabled by default. Developer Impact ---------------- * If the blueprint proposes a change to the driver API, discussion of how other backends would implement the feature is required. N/A Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: jorge_munoz (Jorge Munoz <jorge.munoz@rackspace.com>) Work Items ---------- * Implement backend method to search token by scope * Add flag to Keystone configuration file * Add logic to return refresh token Dependencies ============ None Documentation Impact ==================== Details on how to enable refresh tokens. References ========== N/A

commit_message:
Performance tests for handling nodes in Fuel Client

For performance testing all invotations to Nailgun
were mocked in order to only measure pure client's
performance.

The patch introduces the following tests for 100 nodes:

- list all nodes;
- assign nodes to an environment;
- list environment with pending nodes;
- upload network parameters to nodes.

Blueprint: 100-nodes-support
Change-Id: I849ecd17ba4a9a48b8d4e6dafa75b095ee919ce6

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import random import string def random_string(lenght, prefix='', postfix='', charset=None): """Returns a random string of the specified length :param length: The length of the resulting string. :type lenght: int. :param prefix: Prefix for the random string. :type prefix: str, default: ''. :param postfix: Postfix for the random string. :type postfix: str, default ''. :param charset: A set of characters to use for building random strings. :type chartet: Iterable object. Default: ASCII letters and digits. :return: str """ charset = charset or string.ascii_letters + string.digits base_length = lenght - (len(prefix) + len(postfix)) base = ''.join([str(random.choice(charset)) for i in xrange(base_length)]) return '%(prefix)s%(base)s%(postfix)s' % {'prefix': prefix, 'postfix': postfix, 'base': base}

commit_message:
Don't set up new repository with namespace package

We've decided to stop using namespace packages for new Oslo libraries,
so update the graduation script accordingly.

bp/drop-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I241f51146ea097faab9f5cd4ebba70699f4fb2f7

commit_message:
fix shell syntax in set_roots

The git-filter-branch script assumes Bourne shell syntax, not bash
syntax. Fix the conditional generated for set_roots so it works under
old-style Bourne shell.

Change-Id: I75350f5f20a7bccf76d35d803cae2eb6827292a5

deleted_lines: if [ '' $(for root in $roots; do echo " -o \"\$GIT_COMMIT\" == '$root' "; done) ]; then echo '' cat

commit_message:
make COOKIECUTTER_TEMPLATE_REPO configurable

If the user has specified a COOKIECUTTER_TEMPLATE_REPO use it instead of
the default. This is useful for testing changes to the cookiecutter
template locally before publishing them.

Change-Id: I047030e77a08650bea5930be53012df97c29263b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/54/134254/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Log early boot of Ironic VMs to serial with sgabios

This adds sgabios to the list of packages for Ironic and configures
the libvirt domain to redirect BIOS messages to serial via sgabios,
when console logging is enabled.  The sgabios package in Ubuntu
currently has an apparmor bug, so that is worked around here.

This allows visibility into early boot of Ironic nodes and should
help get to the bottom of a frequent failure we're seeing in the gate.

Change-Id: Ifd18851e2d23d198d36e67883a81afc6a92d2a58
Related-Bug: #1393099

commit_message:
Describes Cinder LVM role bug

*  When node with controller role is added to the environment,
Cinder LVM stays unavailable.

* This change contains workaround instructions for this bug.

Closes-Bug: 1387636
Change-Id: I618c38db3c7167aec405d825904e4e556e2aa8f7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/36/133436/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Note the following: when node with controller role is added to the environment, Cinder LVM role stays unavailable. To work this problem around and unblock UI element, follow these steps: * Establish an SSH connections to the Fuel Master node. Then go to a Docker container with Nailgun and run a Python shell to manage Nailgun DB. :: ssh root@<fuel-master-node-ip> dockerctl shell nailgun manage.py shell * Then run this code in a Python console: :: from nailgun.db.sqlalchemy.models import * releases = db().query(Release).all() from copy import deepcopy for r in releases: r.roles_metadata = deepcopy(r.roles_metadata) res = r.roles_metadata['cinder']['restrictions'][0] res['condition'] = ( 'settings:storage.volumes_lvm.value == false' ' and settings:storage.volumes_vmdk.value == false' ) res['message'] = 'Cinder LVM or VMDK should be enabled in settings' db().commit() exit() * After that the change should be applied to all existing and new environments. Here is an example of console output when the patch is applied: :: http://paste.openstack.org/show/131354/ user@laptop:~$ ssh root@10.20.0.2 root@10.20.0.2's password: Last login: Fri Nov 7 08:14:03 2014 from 10.20.0.1 [root@fuel ~]# dockerctl shell nailgun [root@24a34382eeff ~]# manage.py shell 2014-11-10 06:36:47.625 DEBUG [7fe511c8a700] (settings) Looking for settings.yaml package config using old style __file__ 2014-11-10 06:36:47.625 DEBUG [7fe511c8a700] (settings) Trying to read config file /usr/lib/ python2.6/site-packages/nailgun/settings.yaml 2014-11-10 06:36:47.807 DEBUG [7fe511c8a700] (settings) Trying to read config file /etc/nailgun/settings.yaml 2014-11-10 06:36:47.822 DEBUG [7fe511c8a700] (settings) Trying to read config file /etc/fuel/version.yaml Python 2.6.6 (r266:84292, Jan 22 2014, 09:42:36) [GCC 4.4.7 20120313 (Red Hat 4.4.7-4)] on linux2 Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information. (InteractiveConsole) >>> from nailgun.db.sqlalchemy.models import * >>> releases = db().query(Release).all() >>> for r in releases: ... r.roles_metadata = deepcopy(r.roles_metadata) ... res = r.roles_metadata['cinder']['restrictions'][0] ... res['condition'] = ( ... 'settings:storage.volumes_lvm.value == false' ... ' and settings:storage.volumes_vmdk.value == false' ... ) ... res['message'] = 'Cinder LVM or VMDK should be enabled in settings' ... >>> db().commit() >>> exit() [root@24a34382eeff ~]# exit exit [root@fuel ~]#exit [root@fuel ~]# exit logout Connection to 10.20.0.2 closed. user@laptop:~$

commit_message:
Redeploy cinder/compute nodes if new controller added

Addition of new controller affects cluster messaging,
particularly cinder/computes nodes which is reliant on
rabbitmq_hosts settings

In current orchestration model - the only way to
fix configuration on nodes is to redeploy them.
Configuration will be applied from /etc/astute.yaml and
it is not enough to simply add additional PostDeployment
method in astute

Introduced additional setting for roles_metadata:
- update_required
  should store list of roles that dependends on this role

On deployment stage:
- make update_required list for the whole cluster
- select ready nodes without pending_roles and deploy them

No migration added to keep behaviour on old clusters as it is

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: 1368445

Change-Id: I1735a8b06531018b1240726f5faa4f7ce6e6a631

commit_message:
Added asterisk for required field Key

On the Flavor Extra Specs tab, when the user tries to create
'Other Key' it is also marked as required field. Since this
field it is optional, this validation will be deleted on the
other cases.

Change-Id: I2474a174073535ab5b40c3d6c9683f16f89a38a9
Closes-Bug: #1289565

commit_message:
Refactoring of Horizon navigation

    Horizon navigation is now lighter and written in a full less way.
It overrides bootstrap values when needed, and has been moved to
dedicated files. This changes will offer a better maintainability.
The design has also been changed in a less is more way.
    This patch also remove the old navigation elements (css, html
and python stuff).

Change-Id: Ia0a79b9337d5610ba54cad4f459619972db3a174
Implements: blueprint css-breakdown
Co-Authored-By: miziel-r <robert.mizielski@cloudwatt.com>

commit_message:
Split workflows and wizards in dedicated files

    Workflows and wizards are two different components and need to be
separate in dedicated files.
    In addition the less syntax has been used for a better comprehension.

Change-Id: I28ac74eaebffbd09bef203669a206f855df7b5b2
Implements: blueprint css-breakdown

commit_message:
Made Size parameter optional while creating DB Instance.

While creating Database Instance size parameter depends on
whether trove_volume_support is set. So size paramater is
made optional in horizon.

Change-Id: I6710751f9805af5a2a4c26db8f0edb7206fe6af5
Closes-Bug: #1301359

commit_message:
Error when swift Pseudo-folder includes "="

When a swift Pseudo folder or container name contains a special character, the special character
first gets encoded because of the fix provided for Bug #1231904. The reverse() function of Django
version 1.6 will again encode the special character. Hence in this patch unnecessary urlquote()
have been removed. Unit test cases are updated.

Change-Id: I1e25f8daacbd8d370e409aeb8b7b31becfd8ed0a
Closes-Bug: #1327035

commit_message:
Add barbican-cover to check pipeline

The Barbican team would like to generate coverage reports during the
check pipeline so that we can verify coverage before merging a new
patch. The new coverage job is marked as non-voting.

Change-Id: I86b9eee015f9eea1412b5596c720ffb9415a4e97

commit_message:
Membership workflow implementation w/ AngularJS

  See previous commit for AngularJS integration
  Provides simple angularJS directive + template + controller
  Tested w/ qunit
  Provides sample for future angular adoption

Change-Id: Iec7813dde2f8d3bde78dc47e7a53586a5165f52d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/56/57456/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: angular.module('horizonApp').directive('hrMembership', [ function() { return { restrict: 'A', replace: true, scope: { step: '=', stepSlug: '=', stepShowRoles: '=', stepHelpText: '=', stepAvailableListTitle: '=', stepMembersListTitle: '=', stepNoAvailableText: '=', stepNoMembersText: '=' }, templateUrl: 'membership_workflow.html', controller: 'MembershipController' }; }]); angular.module('horizonApp').controller('MembershipController', ['$scope', 'horizon', function($scope, horizon) { $scope.available = []; $scope.members = []; $scope.loadDataFromDOM = function(stepSlug) { horizon.membership.init_properties(stepSlug); $scope.has_roles = horizon.membership.has_roles[stepSlug]; $scope.default_role_id = horizon.membership.default_role_id[stepSlug]; $scope.data_list = horizon.membership.data[stepSlug]; $scope.all_roles = $scope.convertRoles(horizon.membership.roles[stepSlug]); $scope.current_membership = horizon.membership.current_membership[stepSlug]; $scope.parseMembers($scope.data_list, $scope.current_membership); }; $scope.inGroup = function(group, membership) { var matched = false; for (var roleId in membership) { if(membership.hasOwnProperty(roleId)) { angular.forEach(membership[roleId], function(groupId) { if(groupId === group.id) { matched = true; group.roles.push(roleId); } }); } } return matched; }; $scope.convertRoles = function(membership_roles) { var roles = []; for (var key in membership_roles) { if(membership_roles.hasOwnProperty(key)) { roles.push({ id: key, name: membership_roles[key] }); } }; return roles; } $scope.hasRole = function(member, roleId) { var index = member.roles.indexOf(roleId); return index >= 0; }; $scope.makeGroup = function(id, name) { return { id: id, name: name, roles: [] } }; $scope.toggleRole = function(member, role) { if($scope.hasRole(member, role.id)) { var index = member.roles.indexOf(role.id); member.roles.splice(index, 1); var role_members = getRoleMembers($scope.members, role.id); horizon.membership.update_role_lists($scope.stepSlug, role.id, role_members); } else { member.roles.push(role.id); var role_members = getRoleMembers($scope.members, role.id); horizon.membership.update_role_lists($scope.stepSlug, role.id, role_members); } } function getRoleMembers(members, role_id) { var role_members = []; angular.forEach(members, function(member) { if($scope.hasRole(member, role_id)) { role_members.push(member.id); } }); return role_members; } $scope.parseMembers = function(data, members) { for (var group in data) { g = $scope.makeGroup(group, data[group]); if($scope.inGroup(g, members) === true) { $scope.members.push(g); } else { $scope.available.push(g); } } }; // extract to factory $scope.roleShow = function(member) { var name = ""; var count = 0; angular.forEach($scope.all_roles, function(role) { if($scope.hasRole(member, role.id)) { if(count < 2) { if(count > 0) { name += ", " } name += role.name; } else if(count === 2) { name += ", ..." } count++; } }); return name; } $scope.loadDataFromDOM($scope.stepSlug); $scope.addMember = function(member) { member.roles.push($scope.default_role_id); $scope.members.push(member); var index = $scope.available.indexOf(member); $scope.available.splice(index, 1); var role_members = getRoleMembers($scope.members, $scope.default_role_id); horizon.membership.update_role_lists($scope.stepSlug, $scope.default_role_id, role_members); }; $scope.removeMember = function(member) { member.roles = []; $scope.available.push(member); var index = $scope.members.indexOf(member); $scope.members.splice(index, 1); horizon.membership.remove_member_from_role($scope.stepSlug, member.id); } }]);

commit_message:
Add support for chiscsi iscsi helper

Change-Id: I89f4c0a680f017d6c6687bd9ff2a2945fce2ad0d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder-specs refs/changes/98/134398/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ===================================== Add support for chiscsi iscsi helper ===================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/chiscsi-iscsi-helper The Chelsio iSCSI target(chiscsi) serves as a drop in replacement for the IET target, aiming to provide the same functionality as IET. This spec aims at adding support for said target implementation as a pure iscsi_helper. chiscsi supports offloading of iSCSI PDU's when required hardware (supported Chelsio Network cards) is available but will work on any regular NIC as well. Offloading or lack thereof requires no user intervention once target drivers are installed. Implementation is initiator agnostic as well, no chnages needed on initiator side. Problem description =================== chiscsi target is not currently supported by openstack * For a Deployer trying to use offloaded iSCSI support on target side, no option is currently available. * Manual intervention is currently required to export volumes, as cinder does not understand chiscsi target implementation. Proposed change =============== Add one more iscsi_helper option to cover chiscsi, the driver for this will interact with the chiscsi target implementation to provide same functionality as iet. Use of offloading is dependent on required hardware being present but is completely optional. No intervention is required to enable offload and offloading will happen in a manner completely transparent to initiator side. No initiator side changes are required to make use of chiscsi, with or without offload support. No extra configuration options are required. Alternatives ------------ Only possible alternative is to manually export volumes from target side as well as manually login from compute side. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ If iSCSI offload is available, there is a significant performance boost to be gained. If offloading is not used, performance and resource usage would be roughly on par with IET or better. Other deployer impact --------------------- * No new config options are required besides an extra allowed value for 'iscsi_helper' that would need to be explicitly set to 'chiscsi'. * chiscsi target needs to be installed before it can be used. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: anish7 Other contributors: kxie Work Items ---------- Using iet helper as base, create iscsi_helper for chiscsi, with equivalent commands for all required apis Dependencies ============ * Ability to use chiscsi target obviously depends on target driver being installed, and command utility available on path. No other dependencies Testing ======= Current test for IET target should work just fine for chiscsi Documentation Impact ==================== None except listing chiscsi as an available iscsi_helper References ========== * http://www.chelsio.com/iscsi-target-software/

commit_message:
don't start radosgw service from puppet

radosgw can't properly initialize until the Ceph cluster is populated
with enough OSD nodes, and we already have radosgw restart as a
post-deployment action in Astute.

Closes-Bug: #1390649
Change-Id: If7eaa9371f498f04876b84a4b6420440af26a9ff

commit_message:
Fix problem for 'System Information' page

In get_context_data, exceptions.handle raises error if we get error in
try-block. Set context['version'] to 'not available' and write warning
message to logs instead of calling exceptions.handle().

Change-Id: Id35658e44ac074c10dea06baa074b1e320147c41
Closes-Bug: #1387665
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/39/132039/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import loggingfrom horizon import messagesLOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) msg = _('Unable to retrieve version information.') LOG.info(msg) messages.error(self.request, msg)
deleted_lines: from horizon import exceptions exceptions.handle(self.request, _('Unable to retrieve version information.'))

commit_message:
Also tie Haproxy_service to nova_floating_range waits

This commit makes all openstack::ha::haproxy_service
finish before we start checking for backends for
nova_floating_range.

Change-Id: I300c02290095ad1242524fb79c6d722941c1218f
Closes-bug: #1381982

commit_message:
libvirt: add classes for emulator thread CPU pinning configuration

To allow emulator threads to be pinned to host CPUs add support
for the <emulatorpin> XML configuration element.

Related-bug: #1386162
Change-Id: Id69d58ea6ddb4197538d13e25871532349de24af
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/32/131132/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: emu = config.LibvirtConfigGuestCPUTuneEmulatorPin() emu.cpuset = set([0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7]) cputune.emulatorpin = emu <emulatorpin cpuset="0-7"/>

commit_message:
Always use FakeMemcache for in-process tests

Better isolation and consistency for in-process functests to always use
the FakeMemcache.  If you want to test the real memcache you have real
functional tests.

Change-Id: Ic483f794e122130bd7694c9a5f9a2b1cd0b9a653
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/69/135069/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.memcache = FakeMemcache()
deleted_lines: from swift.common.memcached import MemcacheConnectionError try: self.memcache.incr('test_for_memcached_running') except MemcacheConnectionError as e: print >>sys.stderr, 'Using FakeMemcache: %s' % e.message self.memcache = FakeMemcache()

commit_message:
Make existing requirements parsing more forgiving

* jenkins/scripts/project-requirements-change.py: If not reading
requirements in strict mode, for example when analyzing the existing
branch tip copy of a list, allow for the possibility that
pkg_resources may be incapable of parsing what it sees as a
malformed version string.

Change-Id: I8e13a5e94901f615233ddfb4a5e4589841a01853
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/37/134637/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if strict: req = pkg_resources.Requirement.parse(line) else: try: req = pkg_resources.Requirement.parse(line) except ValueError: continue

subject: Make in process functional tests use sample proxy-server.conf
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-10 18:00:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/5fde470b65885e8ea46c47b5154d3f5624b0c5c4', 'message': "Make in process functional tests use sample proxy-server.conf

This patch was first motivated by noticing that the proxy
server pipeline used for in process functional tests was
out of date with respect to the pipeline in
/etc/proxy-server.conf.sample. Rather than cut and paste
the current pipeline into the in process setup, it seems
like a better idea would be to have the in process tests
always use the sample config.

A further benefit is that in process functional tests will
pick up changes to the sample config introduced by patches -
previously test/functional/__init__.py would need to be
manually modified to run in process functional tests
on new middleware for example.

Obvious next steps would be to do the same for the backend
servers, and to allow alternative config files and dir's
to be specified, but this patch is the first step.

commit_message:
Make in process functional tests use sample proxy-server.conf

This patch was first motivated by noticing that the proxy
server pipeline used for in process functional tests was
out of date with respect to the pipeline in
/etc/proxy-server.conf.sample. Rather than cut and paste
the current pipeline into the in process setup, it seems
like a better idea would be to have the in process tests
always use the sample config.

A further benefit is that in process functional tests will
pick up changes to the sample config introduced by patches -
previously test/functional/__init__.py would need to be
manually modified to run in process functional tests
on new middleware for example.

Note: because the pipeline is now loaded using entry points,
'python setup.py [develop|install]' will now be needed
before running the tests.

Obvious next steps would be to do the same for the backend
servers, and to allow alternative config files and dir's
to be specified, but this patch is the first step.

Also drive-by fixes some typos in proxy-server.conf.sample

Change-Id: If442bd7c2b1721ec92839c4490924ba33e1545d8

added_lines: import mockfrom swift.common.ring import Ring from swift.common.wsgi import monkey_patch_mimetools, loadapp _dir = os.path.normpath(os.path.join(os.path.abspath(__file__), os.pardir, os.pardir, os.pardir)) proxy_conf = os.path.join(_dir, 'etc/proxy-server.conf-sample') if os.path.exists(proxy_conf): print >>sys.stderr, 'Using proxy-server config from %s' % proxy_conf else: print >>sys.stderr, 'Failed to find conf file %s' % proxy_conf return _c = {(k, str(v)) for k, v in constraints.EFFECTIVE_CONSTRAINTS.items()} config.update(_c) 'client_timeout': '4', logger = debug_logger('proxy') def get_logger(name, *args, **kwargs): return logger with mock.patch('swift.common.utils.get_logger', get_logger):# as mock_utils: app = loadapp(proxy_conf, global_conf=config) print 'ANC %s %s ' % (app.__class__, app.logger.__class__) account_ring = Ring(_testdir, ring_name='account') partition, nodes = account_ring.get_nodes(act)
deleted_lines: from swift.common.wsgi import monkey_patch_mimetools from swift.common.middleware import catch_errors, gatekeeper, healthcheck, \ proxy_logging, container_sync, bulk, tempurl, slo, dlo, ratelimit, \ tempauth, container_quotas, account_quotasfrom swift.proxy import server as proxy_server config.update(constraints.EFFECTIVE_CONSTRAINTS) 'client_timeout': 4, prosrv = proxy_server.Application(config, logger=debug_logger('proxy')) global _test_servers _test_servers = \ (prosrv, acc1srv, acc2srv, con1srv, con2srv, obj1srv, obj2srv) pipeline = [ catch_errors.filter_factory, gatekeeper.filter_factory, healthcheck.filter_factory, proxy_logging.filter_factory, fake_memcache_filter_factory, container_sync.filter_factory, bulk.filter_factory, tempurl.filter_factory, slo.filter_factory, dlo.filter_factory, ratelimit.filter_factory, tempauth.filter_factory, container_quotas.filter_factory, account_quotas.filter_factory, proxy_logging.filter_factory, ] app = prosrv import mock for filter_factory in reversed(pipeline): app_filter = filter_factory(config) with mock.patch('swift.common.utils') as mock_utils: mock_utils.get_logger.return_value = None app = app_filter(app) app.logger = prosrv.logger partition, nodes = prosrv.account_ring.get_nodes(act)

commit_message:
Style fixes for controls

Affects a markup of the following components:
* Settings tab
* Change Password dialog
* Wizard panes
* Support page: user statistics block

Closes-Bug: #1392646

Change-Id: Id658e33f1792b73bf505b306751bf192409f3700

commit_message:
Setup quota_items for tempest.api.network.admin.test_quotas.QuotasTest.test_lbaas_quotas

The LBaaS extension tempest test requires the ability to set
quotas also on the LBaaS extension attributes vip, pool, member and
health_monitor.

Change-Id: I6c20a51f61ac7fcc4638a18b546aa61fac2c7475
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/16/105516/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ $Q_QUOTA_ITEMS != '' ]]; then iniset $NEUTRON_CONF quotas quota_items "network,subnet,port,$Q_QUOTA_ITEMS" fi # _neutron_quota_items_add() - add quota_items function _neutron_quota_items_add { local quota_item=$1 if [[ $Q_QUOTA_ITEMS == '' ]]; then Q_QUOTA_ITEMS=$quota_item elif [[ ! ,${Q_QUOTA_ITEMS}, =~ ,${quota_item}, ]]; then Q_QUOTA_ITEMS="$Q_QUOTA_ITEMS,$quota_item" fi }

commit_message:
Add empty id_rsa.pub for nailgun settings template

Commit 5106d31ee80a683c618fada7b0186263e1d20a28 adds a
nailgun dependency on /root/.ssh/id_rsa.pub, but docker
build fails because it doesn't exist during this phase.

Change-Id: Ib36adcebe188627ed62b24b81e708edafd52cdaf
Closes-Bug: #1392698
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/25/134525/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #Workaround for nailgun settings.yaml template RUN mkdir -p /root/.ssh;chmod 700 /root/.ssh;touch /root/.ssh/id_rsa.pub;chmod 600 /root/.ssh/id_rsa.pub

- entry_points added to support backward compatibility (similar to
oslo.messaging)

Change-Id: I108c63a545fd8533c6518caff73b420d0486e5a1

commit_message:
switch to oslo.middleware

- openstack.common.middleware has graduated to oslo.middleware. this
patch changes default to oslo.middleware
- entry_points added to support backward compatibility (similar to
oslo.messaging)

Change-Id: I108c63a545fd8533c6518caff73b420d0486e5a1

commit_message:
Use host puppet manifests for containers

Potentially conflicts with upgrades, but useful
for feature of testing puppet changes with
Fuel CI. /etc/puppet of host system is now
mounted read only inside containers.

Docimpact: impact on puppet manifests for testing

blueprint fuel-master-ci-tests

Change-Id: I63a13fbd5b105c3b4326ad53125dbc4ae06e502e

commit_message:
Added pycrypto>=2.6 to requirements.txt

We've encountered an issue with memcache encryption of authtoken
entries where the authtoken middleware errors out since pycrypto
isn't installed.  This has been exposed on standalone Swift servers
deployed using TripleO.  To fix the issue, we've added pycrypto
to the requirements.txt file, so that installing Keystonemiddleware
will force the installation of pycrypto.

Change-Id: I76370163a3ed5ff447ae990272f9ce8e35fa27b0
Closes-Bug: #1392264

commit_message:
Add resource types for JSON-Schema validation

There are resources cross projects like volume, network, etc.
Now the validation implementations for each resource exist at
the different places.
This patch adds resource types and makes schemas use these types
for code cleanup.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: Ia74f59cc8dc77c95b07f167e8f02cee6d82318f3

subject: Fix Trove gate timeout
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-18 12:23:04.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/trove.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/3436b52d3c1a80840058d78c74579cb67824e83f', 'message': 'Fix Trove gate timeout

Reasons:
 - Trove gate-trove-functional-dsvm-mysql gate hits timeout. For example:
   job started at: 2014-11-17 01:16:00.264 | Started by user anonymous
   job failed at: 2014-11-17 02:51:01.244 | Build timed out (after 95 minutes).
                  Marking the build as failed.

Changes:
 - extending timeout to 180 minutes to allow all other tests to pass

Change-Id: Ibb82952d22e5a993a3266d456849f478bb311928
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Trove gate timeout

Reasons:
 - Trove gate-trove-functional-dsvm-mysql gate hits timeout. For example:
   job started at: 2014-11-17 01:16:00.264 | Started by user anonymous
   job failed at: 2014-11-17 02:51:01.244 | Build timed out (after 95 minutes).
                  Marking the build as failed.

Changes:
 - extending timeout to 180 minutes to allow all other tests to pass

Change-Id: Ibb82952d22e5a993a3266d456849f478bb311928

commit_message:
Basic profiling facilities for CLI

This patch implements a simple wrapper for
profiling different CLI commands and saving
the results.

cProfile is used as a profiling tool; results
are saved as a call-tree, textual statistics and
a DOT-graph.

Performance profiling settings are stored in settings.yaml
which is introduced by this patch and is distributed with
Fuel Client. Custom user settings can be supplied using the
FUELCLIENT_CUSTOM_SETTINGS environment variable overriding
the default ones.

DocImpact
Blueprint: 100-nodes-support
Change-Id: Ia9f6d19960fbe35e034fa85bf6303f3a419a7a75
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/00/129900/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import os import time import cProfile import gprof2dot from pstats import Stats import pyprof2calltree from fuelclient import consts class Profiler(object): """Run profiler and save profile """ def __init__(self, method='', handler_name=''): self.method = method self.handler_name = handler_name if not os.path.exists(consts.LOAD_TESTS_PATHS.last_load_test): os.makedirs(consts.LOAD_TESTS_PATHS.last_load_test) self.profiler = cProfile.Profile() self.profiler.enable() self.start = time.time() def save_data(self): self.profiler.disable() elapsed = time.time() - self.start pref_filename = os.path.join( consts.LOAD_TESTS_PATHS.last_load_test, '{method:s}.{handler_name:s}.{elapsed_time:.0f}ms.{t_time}.'. format( method=self.method, handler_name=self.handler_name or 'root', elapsed_time=elapsed * 1000.0, t_time=time.time())) tree_file = pref_filename + 'prof' stats_file = pref_filename + 'txt' callgraph_file = pref_filename + 'dot' # write pstats with file(stats_file, 'w') as file_o: stats = Stats(self.profiler, stream=file_o) stats.sort_stats('time', 'cumulative').print_stats() # write callgraph in dot format parser = gprof2dot.PstatsParser(self.profiler) def get_function_name((filename, line, name)): module = os.path.splitext(filename)[0] module_pieces = module.split(os.path.sep) return "{module:s}:{line:d}:{name:s}".format( module="/".join(module_pieces[-4:]), line=line, name=name) parser.get_function_name = get_function_name gprof = parser.parse() with open(callgraph_file, 'w') as file_o: dot = gprof2dot.DotWriter(file_o) theme = gprof2dot.TEMPERATURE_COLORMAP dot.graph(gprof, theme) # write calltree call_tree = pyprof2calltree.CalltreeConverter(stats) with file(tree_file, 'wb') as file_o: call_tree.output(file_o)

commit_message:
Add integer types for JSON-Schema

This patch adds integer types for JSON-Schema and replaces the same
code with the types for cleanup.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I8fb997af32d8249b218988bf263a67494120dc01

commit_message:
Use common get_instance call in API plugins part 2

Cleanup API to use common get_instance call which
automatically does exception handling. These changes
are in a separate patch because they required some
unittest changes because of the manner in which some
methods were originally stubbed out.

Change-Id: Ide92ba84cc937191d25da0d643e8e4427a9aa8c7

commit_message:
Add internal methods for setting compute clients

If disabling XML tests on compute API tests by the config item
"xml_api_v2", we need to switch XML clients to JSON clients on
the other project API tests. But current code is difficult to
switch, because compute clients are many and the order is mess.
This patch adds internal methods to set compute clients for
cleanup.

Change-Id: I62bf48845c289b86f1af71e9fbf71e45b509a43d

commit_message:
Defining missing failure_url

failure_url is used to redirect on an API call failure, however it is
never defined. Adding that definition.

Closes-Bug: #1393579
Change-Id: If0f610ece31624f5ae3ad9ba092594232b81a02a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/07/135107/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from django.core.urlresolvers import reverse_lazy failure_url = reverse_lazy('horizon:admin:networks:index')

commit_message:
Fix oslo.messaging funtional tests job template

Reasons:
 - bash 'case' statement misses 'in' statement, because of them recent
   experimental jobs are failing due to syntax error:
   line 8: syntax error near unexpected token `qpid'

Change-Id: I5a3d5ecdd833fdc8a9b6ca586e8dcef84f96404f

commit_message:
Node sorting fix

The changes are caused by moving release roles from simple role name list to role collection.

Closes-Bug: #1393390

Change-Id: I85e083af2d00ccc0bb8f28397be788f7cb527412

commit_message:
Refactoring UI tests

Added teadDown method to cluster test
and fixed method of delete job executions

Closes-bug: #1391474

Change-Id: I9c40bfded3a73bfd9dc36cec6dede821186a585b

added_lines: @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_update_port_with_cidr_address_pair(self): # Create a port without allowed address pair resp, body = self.client.create_port(network_id=self.network['id']) self.assertEqual('201', resp['status']) port_id = body['port']['id'] self.addCleanup(self.client.delete_port, port_id) # Confirm port is created resp, body = self.client.show_port(port_id) self.assertEqual('200', resp['status']) # Update allowed address pair with CIDR allowed_address_pairs = [{'ip_address': '20.20.20.0/24', 'mac_address': self.mac_address}] resp, body = self.client.update_port(port_id, allowed_address_pairs=allowed_address_pairs) self.assertEqual('200', resp['status']) portnew = body['port'] self._confirm_allowed_address_pair(portnew, '20.20.20.0/24')

subject: ResourceGroup don't special-case zero count
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-17 17:40:33.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/resource_group.py', 'heat/tests/test_resource_group.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/d73107bd35cadcad0b4933aec43ef0313b961a45', 'message': "ResourceGroup don't special-case zero count

Currently, when you specify an initial count of zero, we don't
create the nested stack.  Unfortunately this then means you can
never update it, which makes the group forever broken..

Instead, always create the stack on create, even if it's an empty
stack containing zero resources.  This allows subsequent updates
which move to a non-zero count to work as expected.

Change-Id: I494229fcf85a1c28428fa2925c060fc1f40f4f36
Closes-Bug: #1392796
"}]
commit_message:
ResourceGroup don't special-case zero count

Currently, when you specify an initial count of zero, we don't
create the nested stack.  Unfortunately this then means you can
never update it, which makes the group forever broken..

Instead, always create the stack on create, even if it's an empty
stack containing zero resources.  This allows subsequent updates
which move to a non-zero count to work as expected.

Change-Id: I494229fcf85a1c28428fa2925c060fc1f40f4f36
Closes-Bug: #1392796

commit_message:
Only configure Nova DB connection if it is set

The Nova db connection parameter isn't always required. If
you use the conductor you would not need to set this
parameter on your compute nodes for example.

Change-Id: I6901e9d0f781f7ba83d58a2c41343bd80dd9215c

NeutronIPAM as IPAM subsystem

This implements NeutronIPAM that has been proposed in the
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/neutron-ipam.

The goal is to create NeutronIPAM as a pluggable IPAM subsytem
so that any 3rd party vendor can create her own IPAM drvier
by inherting interfaces defined in NeutronIPAM and adding
the vendor specific behaviors that utilize the vendor's
own external IPAM backends.

IPAM subsystem allows a 3rd party IPAM driver to extend the
capability of managing networks/subnets, fixed/floating IP
addresses, and DNS records.

IPAM subsystem creates "ipam" folder under neutron.
The folder contains base.py that provides interfaces for
IPAM management classes.

There are four interface classes defined in the base module.

*IPAMManager* is the main class that defines IPAM driver
behaviors and make use of business logics that are defined
in the three controller classes: IPAMController,
DHCPController, and DNSController

IPAMController enables network management capabiltiy,
DHCPController DHCP management, and DNSController
DNS record managements.

"drivers" folder is created right under the "ipam".
There exists "neutron_ipam" module as the default
neutron driver. The module has NeutronIPAM that
implements IPAMManager, NeutronDHCPController that
implements DHCPController, NeutronDNSController that
implements DNSController.

A 3rd party vendor can create her own driver by creating
a vendor folder under "drivers" and create a driver by
implementing IPAMController, DHCPController, and
DNSController and also by inheriting NeutronIPAM,
NeutronDHCPController, and NeutronDNSController classes.

Change-Id: I7cb4fa2a5c73944b986554196e1001166c148821
'}]
commit_message:
Implements: blueprint neutron-ipam

NeutronIPAM as IPAM subsystem

This implements NeutronIPAM that has been proposed in the
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/neutron-ipam.

The goal is to create NeutronIPAM as a pluggable IPAM subsytem
so that any 3rd party vendor can create her own IPAM drvier
by inherting interfaces defined in NeutronIPAM and adding
the vendor specific behaviors that utilize the vendor's
own external IPAM backends.

IPAM subsystem allows a 3rd party IPAM driver to extend the
capability of managing networks/subnets, fixed/floating IP
addresses, and DNS records.

IPAM subsystem creates "ipam" folder under neutron.
The folder contains base.py that provides interfaces for
IPAM management classes.

There are four interface classes defined in the base module.

*IPAMManager* is the main class that defines IPAM driver
behaviors and make use of business logics that are defined
in the three controller classes: IPAMController,
DHCPController, and DNSController

IPAMController enables network management capabiltiy,
DHCPController DHCP management, and DNSController
DNS record managements.

"drivers" folder is created right under the "ipam".
There exists "neutron_ipam" module as the default
neutron driver. The module has NeutronIPAM that
implements IPAMManager, NeutronDHCPController that
implements DHCPController, NeutronDNSController that
implements DNSController.

A 3rd party vendor can create her own driver by creating
a vendor folder under "drivers" and create a driver by
implementing IPAMController, DHCPController, and
DNSController and also by inheriting NeutronIPAM,
NeutronDHCPController, and NeutronDNSController classes.

Change-Id: I7cb4fa2a5c73944b986554196e1001166c148821

./security-guide/section_security-services-for-instances.xml279(para) msgid "" "As an OpenStack virtual machine is a server image able to be replicated " "across hosts, best practice in logging applies similarly between physical " "and virtual hosts. Operating system-level and application-level events " "should be logged, including access events to hosts and data, user additions " "and removals, changes in privilege, and others as dictated by the " "environment. Ideally, you can configure these logs to export to a log " "aggregator that collects log events, correlates them for analysis, and " "stores them for reference or further action. One common tool to do this is " "an <link href="http://www.elasticsearch.com"><citetitle> ELK stack, or " "Elasticsearch, Logstash, and Kibana</citetitle></link>." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_security-services-for-instances.xml292(para) msgid "" "These logs should be reviewed at a regular cadence such as a live view by a " "network operations center (NOC), or if the environment is not large enough " "to necessitate a NOC, then logs should undergo a regular log review process." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_security-services-for-instances.xml296(para) msgid "" "Many times interesting events trigger an alert which is sent to a responder " "for action. Frequently this alert takes the form of an email with the " "messages of interest. An interesting event could be a significant failure, " "or known health indicator of a pending failure. Two common utilities for " "managing alerts are <link " "href="http://www.nagios.org"><citetitle>Nagios</citetitle></link> and " "<link href="http://www.zabbix.com"><citetitle>Zabbix </citetitle></link>." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/ch_compute.xml60(para) msgid "" "blog.malchuk.ru, OpenStack VNC Security. 2013. <link " "href="http://blog.malchuk.ru/2013/05/21/47">Secure Connections to VNC " "ports</link>"#: ./security-guide/ch_compute.xml61(para) msgid "" "OpenStack Mailing List, [OpenStack] nova-novnc SSL configuration - Havana. " "2014. <link " "href="http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack/2014-February/005357.html">OpenStack" " nova-novnc SSL Configuration</link>" msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/ch_compute.xml62(para) msgid "" "Redhat.com/solutions, Using SSL Encryption with OpenStack nova-novacproxy. " "2014. <link href="https://access.redhat.com/solutions/514143">OpenStack " "nova-novncproxy SSL encryption</link>" msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/ch_compute.xml66(title)#: ./security-guide/ch_compute.xml67(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_compute.xml71(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_compute.xml80(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_compute.xml85(title)#: ./security-guide/ch_compute.xml87(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_compute.xml95(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_compute.xml100(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_compute.xml103(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_compute.xml109(para) msgid "" "OpenStack Configuration Reference - Havana. SPICE Console. <link " "href="http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/config-reference/content/spice-" "console.html">SPICE Console</link>" msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/ch_compute.xml110(para) msgid "" "bugzilla.redhat.com, Bug 913607 - RFE: Support Tunnelling SPICE over " "websockets. 2013. <link " "href="https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=913607">Red Hat bug " "913607</link>" msgstr ""

commit_message:
allow image_id for imageRef in create volume API v2

The create volume request for the V2 API has a property named
"imageRef" with the ID of the image to be used when creating the
volume.
The name of this property is inconsistent as all multi word
properties use snake case and the property in the reponse is named
"image_id".

This adds support for aliasing the imageRef key with image_id when
creating a volume in v2 of the Cinder API in a backward-compatible
way.

Change-Id: I85a5c6734ba05a8a7ea9eff3f849d12fb3d167fb
Closes-Bug: 1375867

subject: RandomString physical_resource_id as id not the string
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-14 15:11:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/b2caf7c3e80b173eb1e83561cefea73216b0780f', 'message': "RandomString use uuid resource_id not the actual string

If someone choses a string length of over 255 we overflow the DB
id field causing an error, so instead use a uuid for the resource.

The actual string is already stored (encrypted) in the resource_data
so it's probably better anyway to refer to the value in one place
and just override FnGetRefId to maintain the existing interface behavior.

commit_message:
RandomString physical_resource_id as id not the string

If someone choses a string length of over 255 we overflow the DB
id field causing an error, so instead use the physical name 
for the resource_id.

The actual string is already stored (encrypted) in the resource_data
so it's probably better anyway to refer to the value in one place
and just override FnGetRefId to maintain the existing interface behavior.

Change-Id: Ide8899a2aa0a9fed037835dc46225f52c291ace6
Closes-Bug: #1392359
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/57/134557/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_max_length(self): template_random_string = ''' HeatTemplateFormatVersion: '2012-12-12' Resources: secret: Type: OS::Heat::RandomString Properties: length: 512 ''' stack = self.create_stack(template_random_string) secret = stack['secret'] random_string = secret.FnGetAtt('value') self.assertEqual(512, len(random_string)) self.assertEqual(random_string, secret.FnGetRefId())

commit_message:
Remove strict host key checking

When migrating and running SSH, don't check strict hosts key.
Closes-Bug: 1393248
Change-Id: I00835f8b78da2dc08a637dcf18c88be66855fd31

commit_message:
Support libvirt memory backing in nova.

Generate memory backing elements in libvirt.xml according to configuration
in nova.conf

For Example: libvirt_mem_backing=hugepages=true, nosharepages=false

Change-Id: I12eae18afe5b95190eac594515dfdf145fd0bdc6
Implements: blueprint virt-driver-large-pages
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/94/134694/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'Maximum of 5 allowed.'), cfg.ListOpt('mem_backing', default=[], help='List of memory backing options.' 'Including hugepages, nosharepages and locked' 'For example: hugepages=true,nosharepages=false') if len(CONF.libvirt.mem_backing) > 0: membacking = vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuestMemoryBacking() for backing in CONF.libvirt.mem_backing: name, sep, value = backing.partition('=') if value.lower() != 'true': continue if name == 'hugepages': membacking.hugepages = True elif name == 'nosharepages': membacking.sharedpages = False elif name == 'locked': membacking.locked = True guest.membacking = membacking

commit_message:
Moves node resource tests to a separate testcase

As an effort to split the Nova driver test cases, this patch
moves node resource to its own testcase class. The testscenarios module
was used since the tests share the same test routine.

Partial-bug: 1325906

Change-Id: Ic8fca63d3dfc47ddf1141179646f5ce3794b4ffe

commit_message:
Update i18n translation for neutron.agents log msg's

Don't translate debug level logs and enforce log hints
Our translation policy
(https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LoggingStandards#Log_Translation) calls
for not translating debug level logs. This is to help prioritize log
translation. Furthermore translation has a performance overhead, even if
the log isn't used (since neutron doesn't support lazy translation yet).

NOTE: this is done on a directory by directory basis to ensure that we
do not have too many conflicts and rebases.

Add a local hacking rule to enforce this.

This patch set enforces the directory neutron/agents

Partial-bug: #1320867

Change-Id: I4bd562e5138c2d2850072440aa121f27e902463a

commit_message:
Moving horizon compression offline

Making the horizon scss compilation and compression happen offline.
Potentially fixing an issue with parallel compression in devstack.

Related-Bug: #1345955
Change-Id: I066c80e06a92302a3f8dc5fd45d127fbde6cf99c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/40/120940/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _horizon_config_set $local_settings "" COMPRESS_OFFLINE True sudo DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE=openstack_dashboard.settings django-admin.py compress

commit_message:
Share server_password unit test between V2 & V2.1

This patch share unit tests of server_password between V2 & V2.1

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I74d67ada017aa43c5221890dd86c204797d870ef
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/53/134453/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # Copyright 2012 Nebula, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo.config import cfg from oslo.serialization import jsonutils import webob from nova.api.metadata import password from nova import compute from nova import test from nova.tests.unit.api.openstack import fakes from nova.tests.unit import fake_instance CONF = cfg.CONF class ServerPasswordTest(test.TestCase): content_type = 'application/json' def setUp(self): super(ServerPasswordTest, self).setUp() fakes.stub_out_nw_api(self.stubs) self.stubs.Set( compute.api.API, 'get', lambda self, ctxt, *a, **kw: fake_instance.fake_instance_obj( ctxt, system_metadata={}, expected_attrs=['system_metadata'])) self.password = 'fakepass' def fake_extract_password(instance): return self.password def fake_convert_password(context, password): self.password = password return {} self.stubs.Set(password, 'extract_password', fake_extract_password) self.stubs.Set(password, 'convert_password', fake_convert_password) def _make_request(self, url, method='GET'): req = webob.Request.blank(url) req.headers['Accept'] = self.content_type req.method = method res = req.get_response( fakes.wsgi_app_v21(init_only=('servers', 'os-server-password'))) return res def _get_pass(self, body): return jsonutils.loads(body).get('password') def test_get_password(self): url = '/v2/fake/servers/fake/os-server-password' res = self._make_request(url) self.assertEqual(res.status_int, 200) self.assertEqual(self._get_pass(res.body), 'fakepass') def test_reset_password(self): url = '/v2/fake/servers/fake/os-server-password' res = self._make_request(url, 'DELETE') self.assertEqual(res.status_int, 204) res = self._make_request(url) self.assertEqual(res.status_int, 200) self.assertEqual(self._get_pass(res.body), '')

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-01 06:37:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/e424cbdbb4d4a6d0b1e0a9e700b1ccea614166b2', 'message': 'Creating individual resources for vpnaas test case

commit_message:
Creating individual resources for vpnaas test case

As per design there is only one vpn-service object per router.
Tempest test cases were failing due to creation of multiple
vpn service object for the same single router by raising an
router in use execption.so creating individual resources for
each test cases.

Closes-Bug: 1376104

Change-Id: Id327488c039374160bbfaa9705b869a38aa0583c

subject: Vendor endpoints to support different HTTP methods
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-21 15:26:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/964cbf20361ec4b22fed1826879f108257e1e2a7', 'message': "Driver VendorPassthru to support different HTTP methods

This patch extend the Driver VendorPassthru to add support to any HTTP method.

When creating a new vendor function developers can specify which are the
HTTP methods supported by each vendor function as a list, if the method
request is not in the list Ironic will return a InvalidParameterValue
(HTTP 400, Bad Request), otherwise the method will be invoked and the HTTP
method request will be available to the vendor function as a parameters
in kwargs called '_http_method'.

This work will be needed for the iPXE driver because iPXE scripts will
issue GETs to the API, but this work is generic enough to be separated
in its own patch.

Partial-Bug: #1382457
Change-Id: I01d9d7fdd7eaf9849db41d50fbb4a78fd31bbfdc

commit_message:
Vendor endpoints to support different HTTP methods

This patch extend the VendorPassthru and DriverVendorPasshtru endpoints
to support to any HTTP method.

When creating a new vendor function developers can specify which are the
HTTP methods supported by each vendor function as a list, if the method
request is not in the list Ironic will return a InvalidParameterValue
(HTTP 400, Bad Request), otherwise the method will be invoked and the HTTP
method request will be available to the vendor function as a parameters
in kwargs called 'http_method'.

Partial-Bug: #1382457
Implements: blueprint extended-vendor-passthru
Change-Id: I01d9d7fdd7eaf9849db41d50fbb4a78fd31bbfdc

commit_message:
Fix horizon package install

We need to copy the local_settings.py file over to the packaged location,
similar to what we do for the source install. Otherwise, config changes to
local_settings.py applied by os-apply-config are not actually in effect. We
must also edit the file to adjust the STATIC_ROOT location.

Add a missing "set -o pipefail" as well.

Change-Id: Ibe0df1596238b5b7f15ac75ce751bc7312b67479
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/11/132811/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: set -o pipefailelse cp /etc/horizon/local_settings.py /usr/share/openstack-dashboard/openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.py sed -i 's#^STATIC_ROOT.*#STATIC_ROOT=/usr/share/openstack-dashboard/static#' /usr/share/openstack-dashboard/openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.py

commit_message:
Fix incorrect service name on Debian in `add-rule`

On Debian, the iptables-persistent service has been renamed to
netfilter-persistent. The svc-map includes both default, ubuntu,
and debian as ubuntu will "fallback" to debian as they are considered
the same family of distro.

Change-Id: I180a580820015a60ceb2221873a38ebbb06cf953
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/41/133541/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(kiall): os-svc-restart etc don't support the custom 'save' # action, so we grab the name and call the service # binary "by hand" instead. SERVICE_NAME=$(svc-map iptables-persistent) service $SERVICE_NAME reload service $SERVICE_NAME save
deleted_lines: service iptables-persistent reload service iptables-persistent save

commit_message:
Make resource check messages more consistent

This adds a method to be used in handle_check calls to make error
messages more consistent, as well as making sure that all unexpected
messages get displayed in the status_reason field, as opposed to
stopping on the first error.

Change-Id: Id855886ae42eabd78dafc6514eca9eebf905f291
Implements: blueprint stack-check

The CLI test test_cinder_service_list checks the output of
"cinder service-list" for a set of column titles. One of the titles
it expects to find is "Disabled Reason". However, this title is not
guaranteed to be in the output; cinderclient only appends it if

Closes-Bug: #1392662

commit_message:
Remove "Disabled Reason" from test_cinder_service_list

The CLI test test_cinder_service_list checks the output of
"cinder service-list" for a set of column titles. One of the titles
it expects to find is "Disabled Reason". However, this title is not
guaranteed to be in the output; cinderclient only appends it if
the value shows up in the response from the server.

Change-Id: I060bad255ff17b132737a8878c26e7d5cf9dce82
Closes-Bug: #1392662

commit_message:
unconfigured clients look in the [clients] section for defaults

This change enables clients that have no specific settings in
the [clients_xxx] sections of the configuration file to get defaults
from the [clients] section.

Change-Id: I071bd77a2e1f0ad366b80c095917a8debc5cef2b
Closes-Bug: 1379958

commit_message:
Add lbaas-lvs-driver

Change-Id: I31e5435c5fa6152e5eefa6066e14993b628053b2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/13/88213/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================= Implement LBaaS using LVS ========================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/lbaas-lvs-driver This BP is a plan to implement the LVS LBaaS driver. LVS (Linux Virtual Server) is a in-kernel implementation of a loadbalancer. Problem description =================== LVS is an open-source implementation and has a different set of features than the other open-source implementation, HAProxy. It is desirable to offer an alternative choice to users. Proposed change =============== It consists of a loadbalancer plugin driver and an LBaaS agent RPC implementation that is derived from the l3 agent driver. Upon loadbalancer creation, a router that hosts the loadbalancer will be chosen based on the subnet ids of its pool and its vip. The common LBaaS code will have a minimal change that handles the routedserviceinsertion DB resource. Alternatives ------------ The alternative is to make this depend on the BP lbaas-support-routed-service-insertion, which was proposed for Icehouse. With lbaas-support-routed-service-insertion, a user must supply a valid router-id to create a loadbalancer. As a major LBaaS rework is expected for the Juno release, it's better to keep the current REST API unchanged. Data model impact ----------------- It uses db/routedserviceinsertion_db.py to track relation between loadbalancers and routers. When a new data model for LBaaS is implemented, a migration code that moves the relation data to the new data structure would be needed. REST API impact --------------- None. Security impact --------------- The LVS driver should be almost as secure as the HAProxy driver, with the following exceptions. * Possible bug in the neutron-lb-member-status-update python code, which is kicked from keepalived processes. * Possible bug in keepalived or the in-kernel LVS implemetation. Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- Performance Impact ------------------ For the existing HAProxy driver, at most one extra DB lookup per RPC callback happens. For the LVS driver itself, its performance impact is almost same as the HAProxy driver. Other deployer impact --------------------- None if a deployer doesn't enable the LVS driver. To enable the LVS driver, a deployer needs to: * Add a service_provider line in the neutron.conf pointing to the LVS plugin. * Install keepalived. * Run neutron-lbaas-l3-agent instead of neutron-l3-agent. The LVS driver cannot be used on systems where neutron-vpn-agent is running. Developer impact ---------------- This proposal has been modified not to affect ongoing LBaaS rework. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: iwamoto Other contributors: <launchpad-id or None> Work Items ---------- Dependencies ============ It requires the keepalived package, which is available both in Ubuntu and Fedora. Testing ======= Tests will be done by 3rd party testing. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== keepalived(8) ipvsadm(8) The LVS homepage (http://www.linuxvirtualserver.org/)

commit_message:
Add swift.mount-check metadata

We've submitted a patch (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/130172/)
to set the value of mount_check to swift.mount-check if it exists,
and otherwise to set mount_check to false.  By default TripleO
deployments set mount_check to false since they do not use mounted
disks to store data.  However we (HP) and others are now using
TripleO to deploy Swift servers with mounted drives for data, in
which case mount_check should be set to True.  This change adds
swift.mount-check data and sets it to the value of the
SwiftMountCheck parameter, which has a default value of False.

Change-Id: I36fece56bafa9fe9c4883b572687b3fc819eeae1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/09/130209/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Logrotate more aggressively on debug mode

Debug log rotation occurs every 10 minutes,
so that disk space can be conserved when running
applications with high volume of logs.

Change-Id: Ia50d3b0ec96a9ef411238bea0e6d162ca02ebe08
Closes-Bug: #1393404

subject: Translate psycopg2 errors/exceptions into tooz exceptions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-15 19:54:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tooz/commit/dcff431b732b77f6467c1a89f63a3d679e3dbbeb', 'message': 'Translate psycopg2 errors/exceptions into tooz exceptions

Instead of raising raw psycopg2 errors/exceptions from the
postgresql driver we should make an attempt to translate
those errors/exceptions into a equivalent tooz exception to
make it so that users of tooz can handle the known driver
failure modes in a sane manner (users expecting to user tooz
as a pluggable abstraction will not be able to handle raw
psycopg2 errors/exceptions, especially if those users are
using different tooz backends at the same time).

Change-Id: Ic95e5fa21bb25096a31b5c5e38aa0b14afa05d87
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-15 20:00:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tooz/commit/ac5be84300d7c4f28304bef74b30d4f5e7f04eed', 'message': 'Translate psycopg2 errors/exceptions into tooz exceptions

Instead of raising raw psycopg2 errors/exceptions from the
postgresql driver we should make an attempt to translate
those errors/exceptions into a equivalent tooz exception to
make it so that users of tooz can handle the known driver
failure modes in a sane manner (users expecting to user tooz
as a pluggable abstraction will not be able to handle raw
psycopg2 errors/exceptions, especially if those users are
using different tooz backends at the same time).

Change-Id: Ic95e5fa21bb25096a31b5c5e38aa0b14afa05d87
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-11-15 20:33:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tooz/commit/b4934eed2556fa826b2baea9070e8254ccf57e6a', 'message': 'Translate psycopg2 errors/exceptions into tooz exceptions

commit_message:
Translate psycopg2 errors/exceptions into tooz exceptions

Instead of raising raw psycopg2 errors/exceptions from the
postgresql driver we should make an attempt to translate
those errors/exceptions into a equivalent tooz exception to
make it so that users of tooz can handle the known driver
failure modes in a sane manner (users expecting to user tooz
as a pluggable abstraction will not be able to handle raw
psycopg2 errors/exceptions, especially if those users are
using different tooz backends at the same time).

Change-Id: Ic95e5fa21bb25096a31b5c5e38aa0b14afa05d87
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tooz refs/changes/31/134731/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import contextlibfrom tooz import utils def _format_exception(e): lines = [ "%s: %s" % (type(e).__name__, utils.exception_message(e).strip()), ] if hasattr(e, 'pgcode') and e.pgcode is not None: lines.append("Error code: %s" % e.pgcode) if hasattr(e, 'diag') and e.diag is not None: diagnostics = {} for attr_name in dir(e.diag): if attr_name.startswith("_"): continue attr_value = getattr(e.diag, attr_name) if attr_value is None: continue diagnostics[attr_name] = attr_value if diagnostics: lines.append('Diagnostics:') for k in sorted(six.iterkeys(diagnostics)): lines.append(" %s = %s" % (k, diagnostics[k])) return "\n".join(lines) @contextlib.contextmanager def _translating_cursor(conn): try: with conn.cursor() as cur: yield cur except psycopg2.Error as e: raise coordination.ToozError(_format_exception(e)) with _translating_cursor(self._conn) as cur: return True elif blocking is False: with _translating_cursor(self._conn) as cur: with _translating_cursor(self._conn) as cur: with _translating_cursor(self._conn) as cur: try: self._conn = psycopg2.connect(host=self._host, port=self._port, user=self._username, password=self._password, database=self._dbname) except psycopg2.Error as e: raise coordination.ToozConnectionError(_format_exception(e))
deleted_lines: with self._conn.cursor() as cur: return True elif blocking is False: with self._conn.cursor() as cur: with self._conn.cursor() as cur: with self._conn.cursor() as cur: self._conn = psycopg2.connect(host=self._host, port=self._port, user=self._username, password=self._password, database=self._dbname)
