commit_message:
Add a load test script - bighammer.sh

This script can be used to give some basic metrics about the
reliability of a cloud allowing us to make an informed decision about
its suitability for CI. As is parts of it could be improved but this can
be an exercise when burning in the next cloud.

It has been used in order to assess hp1 suitability to being added back
actively running CI jobs.

Change-Id: I239bfdfcabe0e3fe531c2751e9d1583b2bb9ee4d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/36/98336/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/bash set -ex [ -n "$1" ] || echo "Usage : $0 <baseimageid> <num-runs> <sim-runs>" # Creates a template image (if it doesn't exist), then runs an # overcloud ci job <num-runs> times, <sim-runs> simultaneously. IMAGEID=$1 USER=fedora if nova image-list | grep $IMAGEID | grep -i ubuntu ; then USER=ubuntu fi # makes some assumptions but good enough for now nova keypair-add --pub-key ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub default || true NETLIST=$(neutron net-list) DEFAULTNET=$(echo "$NETLIST" | grep default-net | awk '{print $2}') TESTNET=$(echo "$NETLIST" | grep tripleo-bm-test | awk '{print $2}') EXTNET=$(echo "$NETLIST" | grep ext-net | awk '{print $2}') TEMPLATENAME="$IMAGEID-template" if ! nova image-list | grep $TEMPLATENAME ; then nova boot --image $IMAGEID --flavor m1.large --nic net-id=$DEFAULTNET --key-name default template-builder sleep 60 IP=$(nova show template-builder | awk '/default-net/ {print $5}') PORTID=$(neutron port-list | grep -F "$IP" | awk '{print $2}') FLOATINGIPOUT=$(neutron floatingip-create $EXTNET) FLOATINGIP=$(echo "$FLOATINGIPOUT" | grep floating_ip_address | awk '{print $4}') FLOATINGIPID=$(echo "$FLOATINGIPOUT" | grep " id " | awk '{print $4}') neutron floatingip-associate $FLOATINGIPID $PORTID sleep 90 ssh -t -t $USER@$FLOATINGIP <<EOF set -ex sudo mkdir /etc/nodepool sudo chmod 0777 /etc/nodepool mkdir tmp sudo yum install -y git || sudo apt-get install -y git git clone https://github.com/openstack-infra/config tmp/config sudo cp -r tmp/config/modules/openstack_project/files/nodepool/scripts /opt/nodepool-scripts sudo chmod -R a+rx /opt/nodepool-scripts cd /opt/nodepool-scripts sudo ./prepare_node_tripleo.sh sudo cp ~/.ssh/authorized_keys ~jenkins/.ssh/authorized_keys exit 0 EOF nova image-create --poll template-builder $TEMPLATENAME nova delete template-builder sleep 20 neutron floatingip-delete $FLOATINGIPID fi function tapper(){ set -x NODENAME=test-node-$1 nova boot --image $TEMPLATENAME --flavor m1.large --nic net-id=$DEFAULTNET --nic net-id=$TESTNET --key-name default $NODENAME echo trap "nova delete $NODENAME" RETURN ERR sleep 120 IP=$(nova show $NODENAME | awk '/default-net/ {print $5}') PORTID=$(neutron port-list | grep -F "$IP" | awk '{print $2}') FLOATINGIPOUT=$(neutron floatingip-create $EXTNET) FLOATINGIP=$(echo "$FLOATINGIPOUT" | grep floating_ip_address | awk '{print $4}') FLOATINGIPID=$(echo "$FLOATINGIPOUT" | grep " id " | awk '{print $4}') echo trap "nova delete $NODENAME || true ; sleep 20 ; neutron floatingip-delete $FLOATINGIPID" RETURN ERR neutron floatingip-associate $FLOATINGIPID $PORTID sleep 60 ssh -t jenkins@$FLOATINGIP <<EOF set -xe export PYTHONUNBUFFERED=true export DEVSTACK_GATE_TIMEOUT=140 export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST=0 export DEVSTACK_GATE_EXERCISES=0 export GEARDSERVER=192.168.1.1 export DIB_COMMON_ELEMENTS="common-venv stackuser pypi-openstack" export TRIPLEO_TEST=overcloud function gate_hook { bash -xe /opt/stack/new/tripleo-ci/toci_gate_test.sh } export -f gate_hook export ZUUL_BRANCH=master export WORKSPACE=~/workspace export GIT_ORIGIN=git://git.openstack.org export ZUUL_PROJECT=openstack-infra/devstack-gate export BRANCH=master export ZUUL_URL=http://zuul.openstack.org/p mkdir -p ~/workspace cd ~/workspace git clone git://git.openstack.org/openstack-infra/devstack-gate cp devstack-gate/devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh ./safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh ./safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh exit 0 EOF echo "JOB DONE" } TODO=$2 SIM=$3 DONE=0 [ -e logs ] && mv logs logs-$(date +%s) mkdir -p logs while true; do [ $DONE -ge $TODO ] && echo "Done" && break sleep 10 # Lets not hammer the API all in one go jobs if [ $(jobs | wc -l) -lt $SIM ] ; then DONE=$((DONE+1)) echo "Starting job $DONE" tapper $DONE &> logs/job-$DONE.log & fi done # Wait for the last process to finish wait

as it is not being used in rabbitmq v3.0+

commit_message:
Allow upgrades only from supported versions

Introduces the `can_upgrade_from` field which is a list of supported
versions. We can control upgrade process now by this field, so user
won't start upgrade from the Fuel versions that we have not tested for
upgrade.

Change-Id: Id56a09845ade075fa4751c7eb164e065d5cad2ef
Closes-Bug: #1392756
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/35/134935/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class CheckRequiredVersion(BaseBeforeUpgradeChecker): """Checks that user's going to upgrade Fuel from the required version. :param context: a context object with config and required space info """ def __init__(self, context): #: version of fuel which user wants to upgrade from self.from_version = context.config.from_version #: a list of versions from which user can upgrade self.can_upgrade_from = context.config.can_upgrade_from def check(self): logger.info('Check required Fuel version') if self.from_version not in self.can_upgrade_from: raise errors.WrongVersionError( 'Cannot upgrade from Fuel {0}. You can upgrade only from ' 'one of next versions: {1}'.format( self.from_version, ', '.join(self.can_upgrade_from)))

commit_message:
add a NoopPackagerMixin class

This is useful when no operating system could be detected or when there
is no PackagerMixin class for the specific operating system.

Also move the object parent class to BasePackagerMixin so the
NoopPackagerMixin can take advantage of it directly. (__getattribute__
needs new-style classes)

Change-Id: If5f3ef23d378ba79a741b1a7f7aa5048889c4bf3
Closes-Bug: #1347501
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/72/108972/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class NoopPackagerMixin(object): """A no-op packager which does no action, but logs all calls""" def __getattribute__(self, name): log_msg = "The %s method on the Noop Packager was called with:" % name def noop(*args, **kwargs): LOG.warn("%(log_msg)s %(args)s %(kwargs)s" % dict(log_msg=log_msg, args=args or '', kwargs=kwargs or '')) return True return noop os = operating_system.get_os() if os == operating_system.REDHAT: elif os == operating_system.DEBIAN: else: bases += (NoopPackagerMixin,)
deleted_lines: if operating_system.get_os() == operating_system.REDHAT: else: # The default is debian

commit_message:
Add more env details into statistics snapshot

Following items are added:
* cluster attributes: common, storage, networking parameters, additional components,
  'vcenter', 'assign_public_to_all_nodes', 'syslog_transport', 'provision_method',
  'kernel_params', 'vlan_splinters'
* cluster parameters: 'net_provider', 'fuel_version', 'is_customized'
* node groups: 'id', 'node_id'
* node parameters: 'error_type', 'online', 'platform_name', 'pending_addition',
  'pending_deletion', 'pending_roles', 'nic_interfaces' (IDs only),
  'bond_interfaces' (IDs and slaves IDs)

Change-Id: I5b015e204c8a4777fcfb22f9a2bfe7e2c51ea992
Closes-Bug: #1393386

commit_message:
Fix comments in logrotation templates

W/o this fix, some log files at Openstack nodes cannot be rotated at the
hourly schedule and /var/log could end up having no free space while
waiting for the next daily based rotation schedule.

Closes-bug: #1393495

Change-Id: I192ebbd31f83fb264307c1c2f1e17a74cec933b3
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/28/135028/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add heat auth_encryption_key handling

* Heat auth_encryption_key now readed from nailgun
via osnailyfacter and it should be used for heat-engine
instances in cloud.
* Add clones for pacemaker in case
of HA mode for heat-engine.

Related-Bug: #1387345

Change-Id: Icc65f5316762421f1477e32fbd9c3f7071f0a2aa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/67/134967/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

test_get_flavor_details_for_deleted_flavor specify "" as the

Nova V2 API validation is loose and the API accepts this
value. However, V2.1 API will not allow empty string as id.

commit_message:
Fix empty string as id in create flavor request

test_get_flavor_details_for_deleted_flavor specify "" as the
id value for creating the flavor.

Nova V2 API validation is loose and the API accepts this
value. However, V2.1 API will not allow empty string as id.

This patch fix this by passing 'None' as id in this test.

Change-Id: I86419368a4c85aaf039278999d3d8c3c1e224c74

because  we can soft-delete stack, that leads to deletion
user_credits and setting stack.user_creds_id to null
(by cascade).
Remove resource.id default value(in database) as specified
in models.
Since we will have sync check between models and migrations
we need to add missing indexes to models for consistency.

Partially implements bp: db-sync-models-with-migrations

commit_message:
Alter models and add migration

We must have correct models i.e. models that correspond
database schema to use sqlalchemy features.
Update models.py and add migration script to correct
database schema and get rid of the difference between
schema and models.
Remove Stack.user_creds_id nullable=False parameter
because  we can soft-delete stack, that leads to deletion
user_credits and setting stack.user_creds_id to null
(by cascade).
Remove resource.id default value(in database) as specified
in models.
Since we will have sync check between models and migrations
we need to add missing indexes to models for consistency.

Partially implements bp: db-sync-models-with-migrations

Change-Id: Iabc4aced0a95e29cea9c48abc4c31be98e8ff9b1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/35/127535/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix resource_setup order in scenarios

As resource_setup() document says, we should check skip condition before
resource_setup. However some functions in scenarios setup resources
before skip checks. We should avoid to setup unnecessary resources as
possible. This commit fixes the order.

Change-Id: Id0529fc80f2b80f028fd078140fe5fd7459e9309

commit_message:
Explains the Fuel buildsystem

Change-Id: Ib2688344d095a9f9daa4b0008d766f8535fba17e
Closes-Bug: 1365441
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/90/124690/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Build options ------------- All build options are mentioned in `config.mk <https://github.com/stackforge/fuel-main/blob/master/config.mk>`_. You can provide options via command line, environment variables or put them directly in config.mk - TOP_DIR - base for calculation of other directories. Not used directly - BUILD_DIR - path for build objects. - ARTS_DIR - path for build artifacts. - LOCAL_MIRROR - path for local mirror. - DEPS_DIR - path for artifacts from another releases (for upgrade tarball). - PRODUCT_VERSION - version of master node and current release. - ISO_NAME - name of iso file without extension. - UPGRADE_TARBALL_NAME - name of upgrade tarball without extension. - OPENSTACK_PATCH_TARBALL_NAME - deprecated - VBOX_SCRIPTS_NAME - name of zip file with Virtualbox scripts without extension. This variables can be changed only in config.mk (Should we allow to change them via environment variables?): ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ - ISO_PATH - full path for the iso (ignores ISO_NAME). - IMG_PATH - full path for the img (ignores ISO_NAME). - UPGRADE_TARBALL_PATH - full path for upgrade tarball (ignores UPGRADE_TARBALL_NAME). - VBOX_SCRIPTS_PATH - full path for Virtualbox scripts archive (ignores VBOX_SCRIPTS_NAME). - NO_UI_OPTIMIZE - use uncompressed UI (for development). Default network settings for master node ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ - MASTER_IP - MASTER_DNS - MASTER_NETMASK - MASTER_GW Other options ~~~~~~~~~~~~~ - BUILD_PACKAGES - deprecated - BUILD_OPENSTACK_PACKAGES - list of openstack packages to be rebuilt from source - [repo]_REPO - remote source code repo - [repo]_COMMIT - branch for checkout - [repo]_GERRIT_URL - gerrit repo - [repo]_GERRIT_COMMIT - list of extra commits from gerrit - [repo]_SPEC_REPO - repo for rpm/deb specs of openstack packages - [repo]_SPEC_COMMIT - branch for checkout - [repo]_SPEC_GERRIT_URL - gerrit repo for openstack specs - [repo]_SPEC_GERRIT_COMMIT - list of extra commits from gerrit for specs repo is on of: FUELLIB, NAILGUN, ASTUTE, OSTF TBD: get list of openstack repos - USE_MIRROR - Use pre-built mirrors from Fuel infrastructure (ext/srt/msk/hrk/none) - MIRROR_CENTOS - Download centos packages from this remote repo - MIRROR_UBUNTU - Download ubuntu packages from this remote repo - MIRROR_DOCKER - Download docker images form this remote url - MIRROR_FUEL - Download Fuel centos packages from this repo. Should be converted to external url. - MIRROR_FUEL_UBUNTU - Download Fuel ubuntu packages from this repo. Should be converted to external url. - YUM_REPOS - should be depricated - EXTRA_RPM_REPOS - extra repos with rpm packages. See config.mk for exact format - EXTRA_DEP_REPOS - extra repos with deb packages. See config.mk for exact format If you want to add more packages to the master node, update requirements-rpm.txt and requirements-deb.txt. FEATURE_GROUPS - Options for the iso. Combination of: mirantis (use mirantis logos and logic), experimental (allow experimental features on ui) DOCKER_PREBUILT - deprecated DOCKER_PREBUILT_SOURCE - deprecated PRODUCTION - deprecated Fuel build system ----------------- Fuel build process is based on make utility. - repos - mirror - puppet - packages - OpenStack packages - Docker - ISO - Upgrade - Virtualbox - Fuelweb_test

commit_message:
Use $((EXPRESSION)) instead of $[EXPRESSION]

$((EXPRESSION)) is POSIX-conform and should be preferred.

Migrate heat-api element to svc-map

This patch migrates the heat-api element from map-services to
svc-map by adding a svc-map file and adding the -a option to
os-svc-install script calls.

commit_message:
Fix comments in logrotation templates

W/o this fix, some log files at Openstack nodes cannot be rotated at the
hourly schedule and /var/log could end up having no free space while
waiting for the next daily based rotation schedule.

Closes-bug: #1393495

Change-Id: I192ebbd31f83fb264307c1c2f1e17a74cec933b3
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Isolate test from environment variables

One test ('test_get_client_all_creds') will fail if any of the typical
Openstack environment variables have been set (eg OS_PASSWORD).

Change-Id: I982f526168be7a5a07b5cd48af522f7f9bc74f2e
Closes-bug: #1376247

commit_message:
Fix incorrect ca argument for heat ceilometer client

Currently Heat ceilometer client are passing the wrong ca argument
during client instantiation. It will cause heat fail to connect to ceilometer
if it's configured with SSL.

https://github.com/openstack/python-ceilometerclient/blob/master/ceilometerclient/v2/client.py#L53

Closes-bug: #1391792

Change-Id: Ib32dfede0ece78bc39e0cab213cb51df8eb62eb6

Make delete_container use expected_success

This is the new standard for tests that use the api client.

See also: I07316db1f51d0562919ed2a50f002011944bfdb1

Change-Id: I309084ab0d13fa3bf3a84dcbe4ddee5b24284b66

deleted_lines: resp, body = self.delete(url) return resp, body

commit_message:
Fix listener for update.start notifications

When listening for update.start, ceilometer-notification-agent
will raise a KeyError exception. This is because, the "id" in notification
message is in message['payload'] not the message['payload'][resource].

Backport note, squashed with dependent patch:

  Don't override the original notification message
  (commit 4292ebd9d409a09b1e1f276ed447c82317cd14de)

Change-Id: I6dd56fbf31c29e26670068004f6fc935b91266f0
(cherry picked from commit 658b89941299370db67b34e8b26750f00c013ca9)
Closes-Bug: #1325172

commit_message:
Update oslo-config-generation code

Oslo's config generator has been moved under oslo.config, which doesn't
require using a bash script anymore.

The patch removes the old scripts and updates the generation task in
tox.ini

Closes-bug: #1373800

Change-Id: Ia757b0d141f8557144108d386496d1e9bfc7333f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/12/135012/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: oslo-config-generator --config-file etc/oslo-config-generator/zaqar.conf
deleted_lines: bash tools/config/generate_sample.sh -b . -p zaqar -o etc whitelist_externals = bash

commit_message:
Install the correct mysql-dev package for RHEL6

RHEL6/CentOS6 requires mysql-devel/mysql-lib packages instead of
libmysqlclient-dev for 'mysql-dev' element.

Change-Id: If5a004720b5982949568e5f79b887b9d5202a576
Closes-Bug: #1393313
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/68/134868/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: install-packages -m mysql-dev mysql_dev_package

commit_message:
Moves node resource tests to a separate testcase

As an effort to split the Nova driver test cases, this patch
moves node resource to its own testcase class. The testscenarios module
was used since the tests share the same test routine.

Partial-bug: 1325906

Change-Id: Iad4fb186d4a574c1d643623fedfed07f6f8ed0cd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/33/106933/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import testscenariosload_tests = testscenarios.load_tests_apply_scenarios class NodeResourceTestCase(test.NoDBTestCase): _instance_uuid = [ ('uuid4', dict(instance_uuid=uuidutils.generate_uuid(), power_state=None)), ('None', dict(instance_uuid=None, power_state=ironic_states.POWER_OFF)), ] _node_resource_availability = [ ('available', dict(res_unavail=False)), ('unavailable', dict(res_unavail=True)), ] @classmethod def generate_scenarios(cls): cls.scenarios = testscenarios.multiply_scenarios( cls._instance_uuid, cls._node_resource_availability) def setUp(self): super(NodeResourceTestCase, self).setUp() self.flags(**IRONIC_FLAGS) self.driver = ironic_driver.IronicDriver(None) self.driver.virtapi = fake.FakeVirtAPI() self.ctx = nova_context.get_admin_context() @mock.patch.object(ironic_driver.IronicDriver, '_node_resources_unavailable') def test_node_resource(self, mock_res_unavail): mock_res_unavail.return_value = self.res_unavail node_uuid = uuidutils.generate_uuid() # TODO(zyluo): The current testcase does not test the case where # instance uuid is not None while node resources # are not available. instance_uuid = None if self.res_unavail else self.instance_uuid props = _get_properties() stats = _get_stats() node = ironic_utils.get_test_node(uuid=node_uuid, instance_uuid=instance_uuid, power_state=self.power_state, properties=props) result = self.driver._node_resource(node) self.assertEqual(node_uuid, result['hypervisor_hostname']) self.assertEqual(stats, jsonutils.loads(result['stats'])) if self.res_unavail: self.assertEqual(0, result['vcpus']) self.assertEqual(0, result['memory_mb']) self.assertEqual(0, result['local_gb']) else: self.assertEqual(props['cpus'], result['vcpus']) self.assertEqual(props['memory_mb'], result['memory_mb']) self.assertEqual(props['local_gb'], result['local_gb']) if self.instance_uuid is None or self.res_unavail: self.assertEqual(0, result['vcpus_used']) self.assertEqual(0, result['memory_mb_used']) self.assertEqual(0, result['local_gb_used']) else: self.assertEqual(props['cpus'], result['vcpus_used']) self.assertEqual(props['memory_mb'], result['memory_mb_used']) self.assertEqual(props['local_gb'], result['local_gb_used']) NodeResourceTestCase.generate_scenarios()

commit_message:
Remove deprecation warnings relating to api-paste

Remove deprecation warnings and backwards compatibility introduced by
commit c355d68a. This commit was introduce in havana and backported to
grizzly. It relates to config options in api-paste.ini.

This commit removes the following deprecated items:
 * cinder.api.auth:CinderKeystoneContext
 * cinder.api.auth:pipeline_factory
 * cinder.api.openstack:FaultWrapper
 * cinder.api.openstack.urlmap:urlmap_factory
 * cinder.api.openstack.volume:APIRouter
 * cinder.api.openstack.volume.versions.Versions
 * cinder.api.sizelimit:RequestBodySizeLimiter

Change-Id: If7c055be0d257dee570da1db4adce2df6e73db14

VMware: remove unused method _get_vmfolder_ref

This method was only used in the ESX driver. That was deprecated
in Juno.

commit_message:
Removes limitation on Ceilometer support

Since Fuel 6.0 can use Ceilometer to collect
metrics from vCenter virtual resources, limitation
on its usage should be removed from User Guide.

Change-Id: I641e7d80cce19e55bd6dcfb5e1760bbec1b342c6

For more details about the Ceilometer plugin for vCenter, see `Support for VMware vCenter Server <https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Ceilometer/blueprints/vmware-vcenter-server#Support_for_VMware_vCenter_Server>`_

Novaclient displays curl statements for debugging/troubleshooting

'}]
commit_message:
Curl statements to include globoff for IPv6 URLs

Novaclient displays curl statements for debugging/troubleshooting
purposes. For IPv6 URLs, curl requires --globoff to be passed in
the arguments. Since novaclient does not use curl directly, this
patch displays the curl commands with globoff option which works
for both IPv4 and IPv6 URLs.

Closes-Bug: #1228744
Change-Id: Ib7099e8e3bbc15f29bbaa1db37ef21e78a74e7bc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/44/134544/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: string_parts = ['curl -g -i']

commit_message:
Implement openstacklib::messaging::rabbitmq

* Add puppetlabs-rabbitmq 4.x as a dependency in fixtures &
  metadata.json
* Implement openstacklib::messaging::rabbitmq to manage user, permissions
  and vhost in RabbitMQ (+ unit tests)
* Documentation

Change-Id: I65190035b51f3d72e4302dae7fad92a280d63cff

commit_message:
Adds "list external networks" test to regular user

For non-admin user verifies that Public networks are visible but their subnets
are not.

Change-Id: I327bed82a9fe2bbd2d574900dbfd182d27892dc8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/25/124625/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: list external networks @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_external_network(self): """Verifies user can see external networks but not subnets """ _, body = self.client.list_networks(**{'router:external': True}) networks = [network['id'] for network in body['networks']] self.assertNotEmpty(networks, "No external networks found") external = all(network['router:external'] for network in body['networks']) self.assertTrue(external, "Found non-external networks in filtered " "list") self.assertIn(CONF.network.public_network_id, networks) subnets_list = (network['subnets'] for network in body['networks'] if network['router:external']) public_subnets = [sub for subnets in subnets_list for sub in subnets] _, body = self.client.list_subnets() subnets = [sub['id'] for sub in body['subnets'] if sub['id'] in public_subnets] self.assertEmpty(subnets, "Public subnets visible")

commit_message:
Don't allow update of ipv6-ra-mode and ipv6-address-mode

These two parameters are not updatable from the nuetron server.
And therefore for subnet-update command, they should not be displayed
in the help message.

Change-Id: I3a6abc3a4e3030d73715d55c340a77b44d41f140
Closes-Bug: #1373417
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient refs/changes/44/123744/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: if parsed_args.ip_version == 4: raise exceptions.CommandError(_("--ipv6-ra-mode is invalid " "when --ip-version is 4")) if parsed_args.ip_version == 4: raise exceptions.CommandError(_("--ipv6-address-mode is " "invalid when --ip-version " "is 4"))

commit_message:
Fixes neutronclient lb-member-show command

The current lb-member-show command uses the id or name for querying.
Since the lb members do not have names, the query returns false
positives.
The unit test for id or name was removed.
Closes-Bug: #1380937
Change-Id: I804cb9d11f5208ea2d7baa58c9d878db93851517
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient refs/changes/15/133115/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: allow_names = False

commit_message:
Update [glance] section in nova.conf for Juno

Use new parameters for Juno like it's documented here:
http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/config-reference/content/nova-conf-changes-master.html
* Use [glance] section
* Delete the glance_ prefix when needed

Closes-bug #1391099

Change-Id: Id6619de87e27b5b476a3bf78387db6c1f52ea4ac

commit_message:
Remove nose things

We don't use nose anywhere in anything related to devstack. The only
legitimate OpenStack things that are still nose are horizon and swift
unittests, and it turns out we don't really run those in devstack.

Change-Id: I215e0f3664f269e0e1b8f5d5f9c70553dededddd

commit_message:
Add 'auth_password' in _SANITIZE_KEYS for strutils

Cinder volume drivers may return connection_info with'auth_password',
This is an example[1], to avoid auth_password to be logged in disk,
we should mask its value with "***".

[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/volume/drivers/ibm/storwize_svc/__init__.py#L432

Change-Id: Id8b67615efab1171e66b46550d5b01e1964f85a3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.utils refs/changes/15/129515/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Test 'auth_password' w/o spaces payload = """{'auth_password':'mypassword'}""" expected = """{'auth_password':'***'}""" self.assertEqual(expected, strutils.mask_password(payload)) # Test 'auth_password' with spaces payload = """{ 'auth_password' : 'mypassword' }""" expected = """{ 'auth_password' : '***' }""" self.assertEqual(expected, strutils.mask_password(payload))

commit_message:
Adding missing table headers

A recently merged patch suppresses table titles by default. The
network detail views display multiple tables and these titles need
to be explicitly enabled.

Closes-Bug: #1393590
Change-Id: Id89aa980774e4e0e60e0506a133eac369e91a7f0

commit_message:
Use oslo.utils.netutils function to set tcp_keepalive

Use netutils.set_tcp_keepalive to set tcp keepalive parameters.
In addition to the existing conf option for tcp_keepidle, new
values were added for tcp_keepalive (to turn on/off this feature,
tcp_keepalive_interval (to specify gap between successive probes) and
tcp_keepalive_count (to specify number of probes).

Change-Id: I60c3bbf5f3deff8bdffe97af76052386e4598b45
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/45/134245/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo.utils import netutils cfg.BoolOpt('tcp_keepalive', default=True, help="Sets the value of TCP_KEEPALIVE (True/False) for each " "server socket."), cfg.IntOpt('tcp_keepalive_interval', help="Sets the value of TCP_KEEPINTVL in seconds for each " "server socket. Not supported on OS X."), cfg.IntOpt('tcp_keepalive_count', help="Sets the value of TCP_KEEPCNT for each " "server socket. Not supported on OS X."), # sockets can hang around forever without keepalive netutils.set_tcp_keepalive(sock, CONF.tcp_keepalive, CONF.tcp_keepidle, CONF.tcp_keepalive_count, CONF.tcp_keepalive_interval)
deleted_lines: # sockets can hang around forever without keepalive sock.setsockopt(socket.SOL_SOCKET, socket.SO_KEEPALIVE, 1) # This option isn't available in the OS X version of eventlet if hasattr(socket, 'TCP_KEEPIDLE'): sock.setsockopt(socket.IPPROTO_TCP, socket.TCP_KEEPIDLE, CONF.tcp_keepidle)

commit_message:
Deprecate RetryDecorator for the retrying package

The RetryDecorator is heavy to maintain. oslo.vmware should
take advantage of the retrying pypi package.

This patches announces deprecation of the decorator and uses
retrying instead.

Change-Id: I22114bfba19567f4716e7a5cb9a305be0e61a09d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.vmware refs/changes/79/102379/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from retrying import retry DEPRECATED: this decorator is deprecated and will be removed from oslo.vmware in a few releases. Please use the retrying pypi package. def _create_session_retry(exc): return isinstance(exc, exceptions.VimConnectionException) @retry(retry_on_exception=_create_session_retry) def _invoke_api_retry(exc): return (isinstance(exc, exceptions.VimSessionOverLoadException) or isinstance(exc, exceptions.VimConnectionException)) @retry(stop_max_attempt_number=self._api_retry_count, retry_on_exception=_invoke_api_retry)
deleted_lines: # TODO(vbala) Move this class to excutils.py. @RetryDecorator(exceptions=(exceptions.VimConnectionException,)) @RetryDecorator(max_retry_count=self._api_retry_count, exceptions=(exceptions.VimSessionOverLoadException, exceptions.VimConnectionException))

commit_message:
Add support for Glance store configuration

As of today, Glance is configured with the filesystem store unless the
swift screen session is started in which case the swift store will be
used.
In this patch, we provide the ability to run stack.sh with a specific
store and provide implementation for the VMware store and Swift.
Support for other stores (such as S3) will come in subsequent patches.

The localrc configuration for the VMware store should be:
GLANCE_STORE=vsphere
VMWAREAPI_IP=vcenter_ip
VMWAREAPI_USER=vcenter_login
VMWAREAPI_PASSWORD=vcenter_pw
VMWAREAPI_DATACENTER=datacenter_path
VMWAREAPI_DATASTORE=datastore_name

Change-Id: I3a0da29a9ded5708805e5971983f4ed75763ae93

commit_message:
Metadata API and VC Metadata implementation

OpenStack compute nodes need to persist some data in vCenter. For
example, to make iSCSI work correctly we need to persist the
static targets used by the hosts in the cluster and created through
OpenStack.

This patch defines a very generic interface of a key-value store and
provides an implementation backed by the CustomFieldManager of vCenter.

This patch comes with unit and integration tests.

Change-Id: I530ab5a77db2d39b2f283c10083b9d9562a0c2b6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.vmware refs/changes/74/102074/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

VcMetadataTest(base.TestCase): SERVER_IP = '10.1.2.3' PORT = 443 USERNAME = 'admin' PASSWORD = 'password' def setUp(self): super(VcMetadataTest, self).setUp() patcher = mock.patch('oslo.vmware.vim.Vim') self.addCleanup(patcher.stop) self.VimMock = patcher.start() self.VimMock.side_effect = lambda *args, **kw: mock.Mock() self._session = self._create_api_session(True) self._metadata_api = vc_metadata.VcMetadata(self._session, "fake_cluster") def _create_api_session(self, _create_session, retry_count=10, task_poll_interval=1): return api.VMwareAPISession(VcMetadataTest.SERVER_IP, VcMetadataTest.USERNAME, VcMetadataTest.PASSWORD, retry_count, task_poll_interval, 'https', _create_session, port=VcMetadataTest.PORT) @mock.patch.object(vc_metadata.VcMetadata, '_get_cluster_moid') def test_set(self, fake_cluster_moid): cluster_moid = "domain-20" fake_key = "test_key" fake_value = "test_value" fake_vc_key = 12 fake_cluster_moid.return_value = cluster_moid class Field(object): key = fake_vc_key def invoke_api_side_effect(*args, **kwargs): if "AddCustomFieldDef" in args: return Field() if "SetField" in args: return self._session.invoke_api = mock.Mock( side_effect=invoke_api_side_effect) self._metadata_api.set(fake_key, fake_value) self._session.invoke_api.assert_once_called_with( self._session.vim, "SetField", self._session.vim.service_content.customFieldsManager, key=fake_vc_key, value=fake_value, entity=cluster_moid) @mock.patch.object(vc_metadata.VcMetadata, '_get_cluster_moid') @mock.patch.object(vc_metadata.VcMetadata, '_get') def test_set_key_already_exist(self, fake_get, fake_cluster_moid): cluster_moid = "domain-20" fake_key = "test_key" fake_value = "test_value" fake_vc_key = 12 fake_cluster_moid.return_value = cluster_moid class Field(object): key = fake_vc_key def invoke_api_side_effect(*args, **kwargs): if "AddCustomFieldDef" in args: raise Exception if "SetField" in args: return fake_get.return_value = Field() self._session.invoke_api = mock.Mock( side_effect=invoke_api_side_effect) self._metadata_api.set(fake_key, fake_value) self._session.invoke_api.assert_once_called_with( self._session.vim, "SetField", self._session.vim.service_content.customFieldsManager, key=fake_vc_key, value=fake_value, entity=cluster_moid) @mock.patch.object(vc_metadata.VcMetadata, '_list') def test_list(self, fake_list): class Field(object): def __init__(self, name): self.name = name fields = [Field('XXX'), Field('%s%s %s' % ( self._metadata_api._namespace, self._metadata_api._cluster, 'YYY')), Field('ZZZ')] fake_list.return_value = fields ret = self._metadata_api.list() self.assertEqual(set(['YYY']), ret) @mock.patch.object(vc_metadata.VcMetadata, '_list') def test_delete(self, fake_list): fake_vc_key = 2 class Field(object): def __init__(self, name): self.name = name key = fake_vc_key def invoke_api_side_effect(*args, **kwargs): if "RemoveCustomFieldDef" in args: return fields = [Field('XXX'), Field('%s%s %s' % ( self._metadata_api._namespace, self._metadata_api._cluster, 'YYY')), Field('ZZZ')] fake_list.return_value = fields self._session.invoke_api = mock.Mock( side_effect=invoke_api_side_effect) self._metadata_api.delete('YYY') self._session.invoke_api.assert_called_once_with( self._session.vim, "RemoveCustomFieldDef", self._session.vim.service_content.customFieldsManager, key=fake_vc_key) @mock.patch.object(vc_metadata.VcMetadata, '_list') def test_delete_invalid_key(self, fake_list): fake_vc_key = 2 class Field(object): def __init__(self, name): self.name = name key = fake_vc_key def invoke_api_side_effect(*args, **kwargs): if "RemoveCustomFieldDef" in args: return fields = [Field('XXX'), Field('%s%s %s' % ( self._metadata_api._namespace, self._metadata_api._cluster, 'YYY')), Field('ZZZ')] fake_list.return_value = fields self._session.invoke_api = mock.Mock( side_effect=invoke_api_side_effect) self.assertRaises(exceptions.VimException, self._metadata_api.delete, 'AAA') @mock.patch.object(vc_metadata.VcMetadata, '_list') @mock.patch.object(vc_metadata.VcMetadata, '_get_cluster_moref') @mock.patch.object(vim_util, 'get_object_property') def test_get(self, fake_obj_property, cluster_moref, fake_list): class Field(object): def __init__(self, name, value, vc_key): self.name = name self.value = value self.key = vc_key cluster_moref.return_value = Field('ZZZ', 'CCC', 3)] fake_obj_property.return_value = [fields] fake_list.return_value = fields self.assertEqual('BBB', self._metadata_api.get('YYY')) @mock.patch.object(vc_metadata.VcMetadata, subject: VMware: Remove target from all hosts on detach_vol
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-18 06:24:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/8cb3486f78c26550f2859d0e383493108e9ca94e', 'message': 'VMware: Remove target from all hosts on detach_vol

With change I787b68c51937abfa592b0e5dcdfbf937a9f2b656, we propagate
iSCSI targets to all hosts of the cluster. However, the targets
are not removed from the hosts when detaching the volume.

This patch addresses the issue by spawning an asynchronous operation
which is removing the static target from all the hosts of the cluster.
This will work fine in a steady system. If the compute node dies when
removing the target, the administrator would have to remove it
manually if there is a real need to remove it.

Closes-Bug: #1331321

Change-Id: I9482254d830e12e72a5687ab4cf391a4a496d087
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-06-18 23:12:40.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/volumeops.py', 'nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_volumeops.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/49cb736e9239d5938820a042f5d4b8bc24ac988a', 'message': 'VMware: Remove target from all hosts on detach_vol

With change I787b68c51937abfa592b0e5dcdfbf937a9f2b656, we propagate
iSCSI targets to all hosts of the cluster. However, the targets
are not removed from the hosts when detaching the volume.
This patch addresses the issue by spawning an asynchronous operation
which is removing the static target from all the hosts of the cluster.

commit_message:
VMware: Remove target from all hosts on detach_vol

With change I787b68c51937abfa592b0e5dcdfbf937a9f2b656, we propagate
iSCSI targets to all hosts of the cluster. However, the targets
are not removed from the hosts when detaching the volume.
This patch addresses the issue by spawning an asynchronous operation
which is removing the static target from all the hosts of the cluster.
This will work fine in a steady system. If the compute node dies when
removing the target, the administrator would have to remove it
manually if there is a real need to remove it.

Closes-Bug: #1331321
Change-Id: I9482254d830e12e72a5687ab4cf391a4a496d087
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/78/100778/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: VMware: Propagate static targets on attach_volume
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-16 23:29:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/cda5f3304f32f75a4b7914a483eeaeba18c842ca', 'message': "VMware: Spread static targets on attach_volume

As soon as a user attaches a Cinder iSCSI volume to a VM,
the host where the VM is running establishes a connection with
the remote iSCSI target. This is good as long as vMotion is not part of
the picture. Indeed, vMotion will be a no-op if the target host
where the VM should be relocated doesn't know about the iSCSI target.

This patch addresses the issue by starting an asynchronous operation
on attach_volume() which will propagate the static targets to all the
hosts of the cluster.

The operation is asynchronous due to the fact that the scan operation
might take a couple of seconds.
If the compute node goes down when progagating, the next attach_volume
will propagate again.
vCenter deduplicates the same static targets automatically so we are sure
that we always have a set of unique static targets.
This patch doesn't leverage discovery addresses but only static targets
which has the advantage of avoiding noise of unused targets in the SCSI
topology.

Closes-Bug: #1330758

commit_message:
VMware: Propagate static targets on attach_volume

As soon as a user attaches a Cinder iSCSI volume to a VM,
the host where the VM is running establishes a connection with
the remote iSCSI target. This is good as long as vMotion is not part of
the picture. Indeed, vMotion will be a no-op if the target host
where the VM should be relocated doesn't know about the iSCSI target.
This patch addresses the issue by starting an asynchronous operation
on attach_volume() which will propagate the static targets to all the
hosts of the cluster.
The operation is asynchronous due to the fact that the scan operation
might take a couple of seconds.
If the compute node goes down when progagating, the next attach_volume
will propagate again.
vCenter deduplicates the same static targets automatically so we are
sure
that we always have a set of unique static targets.
This patch doesn't leverage discovery addresses but only static targets
which has the advantage of avoiding noise of unused targets in the SCSI
topology.

Closes-Bug: #1330758
Change-Id: I787b68c51937abfa592b0e5dcdfbf937a9f2b656
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/79/100379/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add retrying to global-requirements

Retrying is an Apache 2.0 licensed general-purpose retrying library,
written in Python, to simplify the task of adding retry behavior.

Retrying would be useful for the following projects:
- glance
- oslo
- nova
- certainly more...

Useful in the context of:
- session timeout
- retry on specific exception
- etc.

Change-Id: I11c20997d6b7ce37943b55c759845a3e655c84d3
(cherry-pick from 1b20d2775d2b6284962ed125495548273ba5cb0f)

The configuration variable api_insecure used by the VMware datastore
is misleading. In the cinder client, api_insecure set to True means
that the SSL certificates won't be checked when establishing an SSL
connection. However, the implementation of the VMware store is using
this variable to choose between HTTP or HTTPS.

This patch renames the variable vmware_api_insecure to

commit_message:
VMware store: Get rid of api_insecure

The configuration variable api_insecure used by the VMware datastore
is misleading. In the cinder client, api_insecure set to True means
that the SSL certificates won't be checked when establishing an SSL
connection. However, the implementation of the VMware store is using
this variable to choose between HTTP or HTTPS.

This patch renames the variable vmware_api_insecure to
vmware_https_connection which is much more explicit for deployers.

Change-Id: Icefa94b8de166802262d1146b9b78efce3a0c077
Closes-Bug: #1309338
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/96/88496/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: cfg.BoolOpt('vmware_api_insecure', default=False, help=_('Allow to perform insecure SSL requests to ESX/VC.')), self.api_insecure = CONF.vmware_api_insecure self.task_poll_interval) if self.api_insecure: return httplib.HTTPConnection return httplib.HTTPSConnection

commit_message:
Drop usage of RpcProxy from DhcpPluginApi

Drop the usage of the RpcProxy compatibility class from the
DhcpPluginApi RPC client class.  The implementation has been updated
to use the appropariate APIs from oslo.messaging directly.

Part of blueprint drop-rpc-compat.

Change-Id: I81bfd761707c4c587b12877668c4399efe3d652e

self.make_msg.assert_called_once_with('get_dhcp_port', network_id='netid', device_id='devid', host='foo') def test_get_dhcp_port_none(self): self.call.return_value = None self.assertIsNone(self.proxy.get_dhcp_port('netid', 'devid')) self.proxy.get_active_networks_info() self.make_msg.assert_called_once_with('get_active_networks_info', host='foo') port_body = ( {'port': {'name': '', 'admin_state_up': True, 'network_id': fake_network.id, 'tenant_id': fake_network.tenant_id, 'fixed_ips': [{'subnet_id': fake_fixed_ip1.subnet_id}], 'device_id': mock.ANY}}) self.proxy.create_dhcp_port(port_body) self.make_msg.assert_called_once_with('create_dhcp_port', port=port_body, host='foo') def test_create_dhcp_port_none(self): self.call.return_value = None port_body = ( {'port': {'name': '', 'admin_state_up': True, 'network_id': fake_network.id, 'tenant_id': fake_network.tenant_id, 'fixed_ips': [{'subnet_id': fake_fixed_ip1.subnet_id}], 'device_id': mock.ANY}}) self.assertIsNone(self.proxy.create_dhcp_port(port_body)) def test_update_dhcp_port_none(self): self.call.return_value = None port_body = {'port': {'fixed_ips': [{'subnet_id': fake_fixed_ip1.subnet_id}]}} self.assertIsNone(self.proxy.update_dhcp_port(fake_port1.id, port_body)) port_body = {'port': {'fixed_ips': [{'subnet_id': fake_fixed_ip1.subnet_id}]}} self.proxy.update_dhcp_port(fake_port1.id, port_body) self.make_msg.assert_called_once_with('update_dhcp_port', port_id=fake_port1.id, port=port_body, host='foo') self.proxy.release_dhcp_port('netid', 'devid') self.assertTrue(self.call.called) self.make_msg.assert_called_once_with('release_dhcp_port', network_id='netid', device_id='devid', host='foo') self.proxy.release_port_fixed_ip('netid', 'devid', 'subid') self.assertTrue(self.call.called) self.make_msg.assert_called_once_with('release_port_fixed_ip', network_id='netid', subnet_id='subid', device_id='devid', host='foo')

commit_message:
Set xml_api_v2 for Compute tests

Nova XML V2  api support is being removed in Kilo, so we need to
enable here to ensure that the API is still tested in this stable release.

Change-Id: I85ca8f5a7140a2637e64e980015ee30b2a23a46d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/72/134972/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG compute-feature-enabled xml_api_v2 ${COMPUTE_XML_API_V2:-True}

This patch compliments https://review.openstack.org/#/c/85920,
which effectively enables Keystone V3 authentication support
for Nova CLI.

The main goal was to integration with keystoneclient so that
common functionality such as authentication, (http) session
management, and service catalog abstraction are provided
from a single source. This gives us consistency, better
support, and therefore better user experience.

However, there's small gap between keystoneclient session and
Nova HTTP session, which is to keep track of timing for each API
call. This issue will be addressed by a dependent patch.

Change-Id: Iece9f41320a8770176c7eeb5acd86be4d80cc58f

commit_message:
Support using the Keystone V3 API from the Nova CLI

This changeset enables support for Keystone V3 authentication
on the Nova CLI. This provides consistency between using
novaclient as the Nova CLI and using it as a library
as the Keystone V3 support already exists for the libary usecase.

The bulk of the change surrounds the use of the keystoneclient
session object for authentication, retriving the service catalog,
and HTTP connection/session management.

Co-Authored-By: Morgan Fainberg <morgan.fainberg@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Iece9f41320a8770176c7eeb5acd86be4d80cc58f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/00/105900/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import six.moves.urllib.parse as urlparsefrom keystoneclient.auth.identity import v2 as v2_auth from keystoneclient.auth.identity import v3 as v3_auth from keystoneclient.auth import token_endpoint from keystoneclient import discover from keystoneclient.openstack.common.apiclient import exceptions as ks_exc from keystoneclient import session as kssession def _append_global_identity_args(self, parser): # FIXME(dhu): these are global identity (Keystone) arguments which # should be consistent and shared by all service clients. Therefore, # they should be provided by python-keystoneclient. We will need to # refactor this code once this functionality is avaible in # python-keystoneclient. parser.add_argument('-k', '--insecure', default=False, action='store_true', help='Explicitly allow novaclient to perform ' '\"insecure SSL\" (https) requests. The server\'s ' 'certificate will not be verified against any ' 'certificate authorities. This option should ' 'be used with caution.') parser.add_argument('--os-cert', help='Path of certificate file to use in SSL ' 'connection. This file can optionally be ' 'prepended with the private key.') # for backward compatibility only parser.add_argument('--cert-file', dest='os_cert', help='DEPRECATED! Corrected syntax in swift .conf files

In both controller node section and storage
node section, changed [pipeline] header to
[pipeline:main]

(cherry picked from commit 7c4e01ab98930167b160ade81515873256e28a98)

commit_message:
Set xml_api_v2 for Compute tests

Nova XML V2  api support is being removed in Kilo, so we need to
enable here to ensure that the API is still tested in this stable release.

Change-Id: Ia0800b6b2f4affa48bacbbe4582a3ab8a3d3d15f

commit_message:
Make resize function use Flavor object

Currently api layer create dict instead of objects to send to
conductor or compute layer. This patch converted the dict to objects.

Change-Id: Icbf7cc69c1ae0cb501f582820d89c2857ff2d095

commit_message:
provide visual separation in sidebar

Enhance the sidebar display to provide visual distinction between top
level items and lower level items. Top level items are now given a
space above them so they are visually clumped with their children, and
separated from each other. They are also emboldened for greater visual
distinction.

Ideally sphinx would actually tag li items with their depth as a class
tag, but as it currently doesn't do that we can work around it with
setting at ul li, and unsetting at ul li ul li.

Change-Id: I88d4317ec69fe7fd6f5c2198f89de624f0d093da
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslosphinx refs/changes/34/134934/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Update cinder.conf.sample to fix max db conn retries
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-17 19:25:40.000000000', 'files': ['etc/cinder/cinder.conf.sample'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/969a27c56e8c69ba7420d98a0c123dce2ad16870', 'message': 'Update cinder.conf.sample to fix max db conn retries

Another external library change (oslo.db) has broken the gate
because cinder.conf.sample appears to be out of date.  The change
was just to a message string:

   Maximum number of database connection retries during
   startup. Set to -1 to specify an infinite retry count. (integer value)
   ->
   Maximum db connection retries during startup. Set to -1 to
   specify an infinite retry count. (integer value)

This patch updates cinder.conf.sample to get beyond this failure.  The
Cinder team will be talking about how to avoid these issues in the future.

Change-Id: Ia14954842d141b9bd208ce98c5a70a42b014ac45
'}]
commit_message:
Update cinder.conf.sample to fix max db conn retries

Another external library change (oslo.db) has broken the gate
because cinder.conf.sample appears to be out of date.  The change
was just to a message string:

   Maximum number of database connection retries during
   startup. Set to -1 to specify an infinite retry count. (integer value)
   ->
   Maximum db connection retries during startup. Set to -1 to
   specify an infinite retry count. (integer value)

This patch updates cinder.conf.sample to get beyond this failure.  The
Cinder team will be talking about how to avoid these issues in the future.

Change-Id: Ia14954842d141b9bd208ce98c5a70a42b014ac45
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/59/135059/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Maximum number of database connection retries during # startup. Set to -1 to specify an infinite retry count. # (integer value)
deleted_lines: # Maximum db connection retries during startup. Set to -1 to # specify an infinite retry count. (integer value)

commit_message:
Move out of the oslo namespace package

Move the public API out of oslo.concurrency to oslo_concurrency. Retain
the ability to import from the old namespace package for backwards
compatibility for this release cycle.

bp/drop-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I20d1647b1c3ef8cab3b69eccfe168eeb01703b72

commit_message:
Implement Midonet Juno Security Group Api calls

This patch is part of a series of patches converting the current midonet plugin
code to the new model described in blueprint midonet-plugin-juno. This patch
focuses specifically on the "security group" handlers.

Change-Id: I76d3c8809aff2fc1b74de0fab6712b8495d1413b
Partially-Implements: blueprint midonet-plugin-juno

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # @author: Ryu Ishimoto, Midokura Japan KK from neutron.common import constants def subnet_str(cidr): """Convert the cidr string to x.x.x.x_y format :param cidr: CIDR in x.x.x.x/y format """ if cidr is None: return None return cidr.replace("/", "_") def net_addr(addr): """Get network address prefix and length from a given address.""" if addr is None: return (None, None) nw_addr, nw_len = addr.split('/') nw_len = int(nw_len) return nw_addr, nw_len def get_ethertype_value(ethertype): """Convert string representation of ethertype to the numerical.""" if ethertype is None: return None mapping = { 'ipv4': 0x0800, 'ipv6': 0x86DD, 'arp': 0x806 } return mapping.get(ethertype.lower()) def get_protocol_value(protocol): """Convert string representation of protocol to the numerical.""" if protocol is None: return None if isinstance(protocol, int): return protocol mapping = { constants.PROTO_NAME_TCP: constants.PROTO_NUM_TCP, constants.PROTO_NAME_UDP: constants.PROTO_NUM_UDP, constants.PROTO_NAME_ICMP: constants.PROTO_NUM_ICMP } return mapping.get(protocol.lower())

Add spec for MidoNet L3-ext-gw-modes support

Blueprint: midonet-support-l3-ext-gw-modes
Change-Id: I397c29f65ee81c4458947b3e87345d14d7dec4ac
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/85/94785/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ========================================== Quota extension support for MidoNet plugin ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/midonet-support-l3-ext-gw-modes Add support for L3-ext-gw-modes in MidoNet plugin. Problem description =================== Current MidoNet plugin does not support L3-ext-gw-modes[1]. Because of that, operaters cannot support a usecase where tenant networks are directly routed from/to public networks through tenant router. Proposed change =============== Support this feature by making a chenge in the Neutron database as well as the plugin so it honors the enable_snat field and set up the backend accordingly. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- enable_snat column will be added to "routers" table. REST API impact --------------- Users can start using the enable_snat attribute in Router API. Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- This introduces a new DB migration script. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: tomoe Other contributors: Work Items ---------- - Add a database migration script for routers. - Modify the plugin. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= This feature should be covered by the tempest test: tempest.api.network.test_routers.RoutersTest.test_update_router_set_gateway_without_snat. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== [1]: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/L3-ext-gw-modes-spec

Fix L2 agent does not remove unused ipset set

The patch fixes L2 agent does not remove unused ipset set when security
group contains rules for only IPv4 or IPv6.

Closes-bug: #1373287

"}]
commit_message:
Exclude testtools 1.4.0

When running tempest with testtools 1.4.0 attributes aren't being added to the
test_id. This causes the regex excludes we use for the slow tests in tempest to not
work, and the slow jobs get run everywhere, while the slow jobs fail to have any tests. 

Change-Id: I561e98bf363d2dd8e8b3a20cea7d2dcbfa034e98

commit_message:
Claim post requires a body

One of the claim's test scenario used to send `None` to the server. The
later failed to deserialize this body and the response returned 400.
This patch removes `None` from the test scenario since a body is
requires to created a claim to begin with.

Change-Id: If2c6acefc84fb2b7cc5b4a26e1784b74a1ae1e22
Closes-bug: #1383604

commit_message:
deprecate crypto package

Based on our discussion at the Kilo summit, we indicated that this
module would be marked deprecated but retained until a more complete
solution is implemented elsewhere.

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/kilo-oslo-library-proposals

Change-Id: I0d31b20148339912f984a899600336a98f592d72

commit_message:
deprecate apiclient package

Based on our discussion at the Kilo summit, we indicated that this
module would be marked deprecated but retained until the new SDK is
completed.

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/kilo-oslo-library-proposals

Change-Id: Id5e624995cd8fb9da4265db7d84eac6b699679b2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/24/134024/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ######################################################################## ## ## THIS MODULE IS DEPRECATED ## ## Please refer to ## https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/kilo-oslo-library-proposals for ## the discussion leading to this deprecation. ## ## We recommend checking out the python-openstacksdk project ## (https://launchpad.net/python-openstacksdk) instead. ## ########################################################################

commit_message:
Add uuidutils to oslo.utils

Oslo team was vacillating about moving uuidutils to
oslo.utils in the past. The consensus now is that it
may be still handy and has too many references for us
to fix (change references from uuidutils to use uuid.*
package directly)

Co-Authored-By: Victor Sergeyev <vsergeyev@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I1b2e430915125da6cf505a8525c148898e8ec08a

added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2012 Intel Corporation. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import uuid from oslotest import base as test_base from oslo.utils import uuidutils class UUIDUtilsTest(test_base.BaseTestCase): def test_generate_uuid(self): uuid_string = uuidutils.generate_uuid() self.assertTrue(isinstance(uuid_string, str)) self.assertEqual(len(uuid_string), 36) # make sure there are 4 dashes self.assertEqual(len(uuid_string.replace('-', '')), 32) def test_is_uuid_like(self): self.assertTrue(uuidutils.is_uuid_like(str(uuid.uuid4()))) def test_id_is_uuid_like(self): self.assertFalse(uuidutils.is_uuid_like(1234567)) def test_name_is_uuid_like(self): self.assertFalse(uuidutils.is_uuid_like('zhongyueluo'))

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-30 00:20:49.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/token/persistence/backends/sql.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/6bf78255b2529fd3a83e749101130cf595f1544e', 'message': 'Prevent infinite loop in token_flush

If there were > batch_size tokens with the same expiration time then
token_flush could hang because it picks the expiration time as the
target to delete with a < check.

Closes-Bug: #1387401
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent infinite loop in token_flush

If there were > batch_size tokens with the same expiration time then
token_flush could hang because it picks the expiration time as the
target to delete with a < check.

The check is changed to a <= so that the tokens in the batch are
deleted so that token_flush always makes progress.

Change-Id: Id0b6f7fcdf7ebb02a6f38fbb9a4e25bf714a614c
Closes-Bug: #1387401
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/99/131899/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: delete_query = query.filter(TokenModel.expires <=

commit_message:
Fix ReST exception mapping

Reasons:
- When regular user tries to access admin API
  endpoints Trove will raise H401 exception
  (Unauthorized), but user passed authorization.
- webob has specific section for HTTP Forbidden exceptions.
- This issue violates RFC 2616.

Changes:
- fixing exception mapping.
- fixing tests.

Change-Id: I840360c2077d6c75279894d6eecd65a8cdeb8f6c
Closes-Bug: #1351296

commit_message:
Corrected syntax in swift .conf files

In both controller node section and storage
node section, changed [pipeline] header to
[pipeline:main]

backport: juno

Change-Id: Id801dc1bfb07cdb7cb1e7d29e361dc7bd3be0a63
Closes-Bug: #1392839

commit_message:
Added a check for 1404 for starting the service

https://www.getchef.com/blog/2014/09/18/chef-where-is-my-ubuntu-14-04-service-support/
I'm not sure how to write a test for this, but it's pretty straight
forward.

I may be adding others but this is the first :)

Change-Id: Iff0d997ef6c9446558de77c9f5b1f19cb9a26725

commit_message:
Refactor some common code in _get_schema

This patch does not make any functional change. It merely removes
some code that could be shared between VDICT and LIST in _get_schema.

Change-Id: If4d709c1ce9ad2d34b2803e6106f0cda5c666eaa

commit_message:
Make check_transation_type private and add docstring

The method check_transation_type is a helper method thats only used
in the DataSourceDriver baseclass so it should be made private. This
patch also adds a docstring for this method.

Related-bug: 1387185
Change-Id: Ie8ef6c76b8c22368bfc6359e5c589c77a4cd4fc3

commit_message:
Adds Object Storage v1 API specification information

Goal is to start maintaining API specs in the specs repos
for each project to eliminate maintenance of object-api repo.

Change-Id: I63691a4d220d9db0ce0a91e3c664524fac235d56
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift-specs refs/changes/84/129384/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: =============== Discoverability =============== Your Object Storage system might not enable all features that you read about because your service provider chooses which features to enable. To discover which features are enabled in your Object Storage system, use the ``/info`` request. However, your service provider might have disabled the ``/info`` request, or you might be using an older version that does not support the ``/info`` request. To use the ``/info`` request, send a **GET** request using the ``/info`` path to the Object Store endpoint as shown in this example: .. code:: screen # curl https://storage.clouddrive.com/info This example shows a truncated response body: .. code:: programlisting { "swift":{ "version":"1.11.0" }, "staticweb":{ }, "tempurl":{ } } This output shows that the Object Storage system has enabled the static website and temporary URL features.

commit_message:
Sample of refactoring test code for a retargetable client

The goal is to move the following out of tests into the client:
1. validation
2. serialize/deserialize
3. resource management using addCleanUp

The client will return an object as an attribute dict so members can be
access with instance variable syntax.

This change allows an abstract definition of the client interface which
will allow decoupling of "where the tests live" and "what client is used".
Clients might be a tempest client, official client, or direct API calls to
a project.

In this sample, references to values in ports and fixed ips still use dict
syntax because those clients were not changed. The new client methods are
prepended with x_ in this sample to prevent other unmodified tests from
failing.

Change-Id: I8be2f4bec5eb4cdf0efcbbd26ce090501b8e8c30

Rename non-template example-container-config.yaml

Any file with a .yaml extension gets validated as a heat template,
so don't do that for this kubernetes manifest.

commit_message:
Added test to check that an expired secret cannot be retrieved

Added a single test that creates and expires a secret.
The test then checks that secret can no longer be retrieved.

Change-Id: Iaf2a250f4f554509cdef1adf82ca1682a0047e0b

commit_message:
Creating a policy sample

    Creating a policy sample containing cloud_admin,
    domain_admin, project_admin and project_member roles,
    and replacing it for the currently
    policy.v3cloudsample.json.

    Related commit:
    Cinder   - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/123433/
    Glance   - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/123216/
    Nova     - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/123428/
    Neutron  - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/123440/
    Keystone - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/123509/

    blueprint policy-sample

    Co-Authored-By: Rodrigo Duarte <rodrigods@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
    Co-Authored-By: Raildo Mascena de Sousa Filho <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
    Co-Authored-By: Henrique Truta <henrique@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

    closes-bug: #1391504
    Change-Id: I6b81cd4e599ed00827dff4fb644bc0a7c909ac59

commit_message:
Any empty auth_url produces strange error

An empty auth_url would produce an Index error trying to parse
it.  It should produce an proper exception (AuthorizationFailure)

Change-Id: I1816ff199286b7194b32c20c8aa10fa917259b35

commit_message:
Add puppet-lint-param-docs plugins to puppet-lint

- This puppet-lint plugin checks if all parameters are documented
- Fix some unaligned arrows
- https://github.com/domcleal/puppet-lint-param-docs

Change-Id: I5e73747b726191bc4fc55e6e227892507e185871
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Minor test tweak to run without an instance

This allows the tests to work in an environment with volume support
but without creating a volume for a specific instance.

Change-Id: I2b02f57b94fd71fcea32a1b5469087fc804ffcca

commit_message:
Fix check for image existence

Having the image_exists call inside the brackets causes it to be a
noop, which means that if you try to run devtest with -c but
without a seed image present it won't properly recognize that and
build one.

Change-Id: I560b9ac381d1c0a544f35de607405ad04b41eff8

commit_message:
Add synchronized_domain decorator

As a temporary fix for bug 1392762, we serialize concurrent
modifications to a domain, preventing the issue described in
the bug. We choose a temporary fix, as pools will make a no
locking fix significantly easier.

Closes-Bug: 1392762
Change-Id: Ifb1bba170983023aedbc63ed3559fe8b28359efa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/42/134942/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import itertools import inspectfrom oslo.concurrency import lockutilsDOMAIN_LOCKS = threading.local()def synchronized_domain(new_domain=False): """Ensures only a single operation is in progress for each domain A Decorator which ensures only a single operation can be happening on a single domain at once, within the current designate-central instance """ def outer(f): @functools.wraps(f) def wrapper(self, *args, **kwargs): if not hasattr(DOMAIN_LOCKS, 'held'): # Create the held set if necessary DOMAIN_LOCKS.held = set() DOMAIN_LOCKS.new_domain = new_domain domain_id = None if 'domain_id' in kwargs: domain_id = kwargs['domain_id'] elif 'domain' in kwargs: domain_id = kwargs['domain'].id # The domain object won't always have an ID set, we should attempt # to locate an Object containing the ID. if domain_id is None: for arg in itertools.chain(kwargs.values(), args): if isinstance(arg, objects.Domain): domain_id = arg.id if domain_id is not None: break elif (isinstance(arg, objects.RecordSet) or isinstance(arg, objects.Record)): domain_id = arg.domain_id if domain_id is not None: break if not DOMAIN_LOCKS.new_domain and domain_id is None: raise Exception('Failed to determine domain id for ' 'synchronized operation') if domain_id in DOMAIN_LOCKS.held: # Call the wrapped function return f(self, *args, **kwargs) else: with lockutils.lock('domain-%s' % domain_id): DOMAIN_LOCKS.held.add(domain_id) # Call the wrapped function result = f(self, *args, **kwargs) DOMAIN_LOCKS.held.remove(domain_id) return result return wrapper return outer @synchronized_domain(new_domain=True) @synchronized_domain() @synchronized_domain() @synchronized_domain() @synchronized_domain() @synchronized_domain() @synchronized_domain() @synchronized_domain() @synchronized_domain() @synchronized_domain() domain_id=rset['domain_id'], recordset_id=rset['id'], record_id=record['id']) domain_id=zone['id'], recordset=objects.RecordSet(**recordset_values)) domain_id=zone['id'], recordset_id=recordset['id'], record=objects.Record(**record_values)) domain_id=record['domain_id'], recordset_id=record['recordset_id'], record_id=record['id'])
deleted_lines: rset['domain_id'], rset['id'], record['id']) zone['id'], objects.RecordSet(**recordset_values)) zone['id'], recordset['id'], objects.Record(**record_values)) record['domain_id'], record['recordset_id'], record['id'])

commit_message:
dev-quickstart.rst update to add required packages

* added unspecifed required package "python-tox" for Ubuntu/Debian,
  and removed "py26" from "tox.ini" so that "tox" command doesn't
  invoke the tests in Python 2.6 environment.

Change-Id: I57df22a54fc08f2bb53a17d13b70706952815871
Closes-Bug: #1392304

commit_message:
Correct use of the image_exists function

Since image_exists is a function we don't need to
wrap it in []'s when testing that is passes. Doing
so actually means it will always render true.

Do this instead:

 if image_exists && [ -n "$USE_CACHE" ]; then

Change-Id: I9cbb5e74a038b157c75d1c91bef086a620b1cca6

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-14 14:13:12.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/acquire-image'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator/commit/d6e118e7f9113d4a884d055918d9d3db8e2005c7', 'message': "Fix call to show_options if no BUILD_COMMAND set

Fixes an issue where if you called acquire-image with less
that 2 ARGS it would fail without printing any error message.
This is because the IMAGE_NAME and/or BUILD_COMMAND variables
were obtained from $1 which may or may not be set.

To work around this we do a simple error check on the number of args
before setting (and checking) these variables. This makes it
so acquire-image properly prints its usuage message if args aren't
present.

Change-Id: Iaa1209923fd5259a153312df65519d31f1d929a1
"}]
commit_message:
Fix call to show_options if no BUILD_COMMAND set

Fixes an issue where if you called acquire-image with less
that 2 ARGS it would fail without printing any error message.
This is because the IMAGE_NAME and/or BUILD_COMMAND variables
were obtained from $1 which may or may not be set.

To work around this we do a simple error check on the number of args
before setting (and checking) these variables. This makes it
so acquire-image properly prints its usuage message if args aren't
present.

Change-Id: Iaa1209923fd5259a153312df65519d31f1d929a1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/39/134539/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ "$#" -lt 2 ]; then show_options 1 fi

commit_message:
Fix couple of nit picks

Fixed two nit picks:

1) in service_instance module was improper statement about amount of
external methods.

2) After commit merge
https://github.com/openstack/manila/commit/883e02f2

part of etc/manila/README.manila.conf info became outdated.

Change-Id: I68b9efc9bc1f701cb4ea8dbecf69ec58f7cb5df3

added_lines: class GetAttributeTest(TestCase): def _load_template(self, filename): return ToscaTemplate(os.path.join( os.path.dirname(os.path.abspath(__file__)), 'data', filename)) def test_get_attribute_in_outputs(self): tpl = self._load_template('tosca_single_instance_wordpress.yaml') website_url_output = [ x for x in tpl.outputs if x.name == 'website_url'][0] self.assertTrue(isinstance(website_url_output.value, functions.GetAttribute)) self.assertEqual('server', website_url_output.value.node_template_name) self.assertEqual('ip_address', website_url_output.value.attribute_name) def test_get_attribute_invalid_args(self): expected_msg = 'Expected arguments: node-template-name, attribute-name' err = self.assertRaises(ValueError, functions.get_function, None, None, {'get_attribute': []}) self.assertIn(expected_msg, six.text_type(err)) err = self.assertRaises(ValueError, functions.get_function, None, None, {'get_attribute': ['x']}) self.assertIn(expected_msg, six.text_type(err)) err = self.assertRaises(ValueError, functions.get_function, None, None, {'get_attribute': ['x', 'y', 'z']}) self.assertIn(expected_msg, six.text_type(err)) def test_get_attribute_unknown_node_template_name(self): err = self.assertRaises( KeyError, self._load_template, 'functions/test_get_attribute_unknown_node_template_name.yaml') self.assertIn('unknown_node_template', six.text_type(err)) def test_get_attribute_unknown_attribute(self): err = self.assertRaises( KeyError, self._load_template, 'functions/test_get_attribute_unknown_attribute_name.yaml') self.assertIn('unknown_attribute', six.text_type(err)) self.assertIn('server', six.text_type(err))

Add a keystone-specs-core gerrit group

Add the keystone-specs-core gerrit permission group. This is to
allow core reviewers for specs independent of code review.

commit_message:
Improve wait-for-* execs

Right after start haproxy marks all backends as UP. It marks
problem ones as DOWN only after health-checks. So we should not
rely on BACKEND status while INI is in process.

Change-Id: Ia3743d446826ee1a9d42799a83e14a911a577966
Related-bug: #1391180
(cherry picked from commit 360ef59e8f828243304a669328257be8504b8df6)

commit_message:
Add heat auth_encryption_key handling

* Heat auth_encryption_key now readed from nailgun
via osnailyfacter and it should be used for heat-engine
instances in cloud.
* Add clones for pacemaker in case
of HA mode for heat-engine.
Related-Bug: #1387345

Change-Id: Icc65f5316762421f1477e32fbd9c3f7071f0a2aa

commit_message:
Discard 'self' from '_joined_groups' if we got booted out

When running watchers we scan over all the currently existing
groups, during this scan of groups and associated members we
can determine if the the member that the driver represents has
been kicked out of the group and clean out our '_joined_group'
set when this has been detected.

Change-Id: Ib17543f2401804d2d3573d9b8bdeb55cb2c9f606
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tooz refs/changes/92/132092/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # I was booted out... # # TODO(harlowja): perhaps we should have a way to notify # watchers that this has happened (the below mechanism will # also do this, but it might be better to have a separate # way when 'self' membership is lost)? if (group_id in self._joined_groups and self._member_id not in group_members): self._joined_groups.discard(group_id)

commit_message:
Fix client side versions in dhcp rpc API

The dhcp rpc API has two version (1.0 and 1.1).  The proper way to use
versioning for this is to only specify '1.1' from the client side when
you require that the remote side implements at least version '1.1' for
the method to work.  Otherwise, '1.0' should still be specified.  The
previous code specified '1.1' always.

Related to blueprint drop-rpc-compat.

Change-Id: I9468f8f67d80c5d064137f917fc04f9335a3ed55
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/38/133738/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: target = messaging.Target(topic=topic, version='1.0') cctxt = self.client.prepare(version='1.1') cctxt = self.client.prepare(version='1.1') cctxt = self.client.prepare(version='1.1')
deleted_lines: target = messaging.Target(topic=topic, version='1.1') cctxt = self.client.prepare() cctxt = self.client.prepare() cctxt = self.client.prepare()
